items.content:
Solutions Product Manager at Jitterbit

Remote
  • Remote, Remote, Remote, United States
  • Full-time

Company Description

At Jitterbit, our mission is to make apps do more for the people who use them every day. We make this possible with solutions that democratize integration, making it fast, easy and cost-effective to seamlessly connect your data, apps, and devices.

All of our solutions are available on Harmony, the world’s fastest cloud integration platform.

Job Description

What you will be doing:

You will be a senior member of the product management team reporting to the VP of Product Management. You will own the strategy, roadmap, and execution of Jitterbit’s Solution offerings. A typical day or week for you might include: researching and formulating a differentiated product, solution or set of features for a particular vertical or ecosystem, working with Product Marketing on messaging & positioning, writing JIRA epics and tickets, reviewing recent work with the engineering team and answering questions on design, writing offering plans or a requirements document, participating in sales calls with prospects and clients, or building a demo for training purposes.

You will be interacting with all areas of the company and our clients, including senior leadership. You will be the “go-to” person for your Solutions and known as the thought leader and expert in your Solution area.

Goals for this role:
In the first 30 days, you will

  • Become familiar with the overall Harmony platform and offerings.
  • Be able to demonstrate hands-on, working knowledge of our platform via demo.
  • Have working relationships with other departments that intersect with your solution areas.
  • Are able to articulate a long term vision and 12-month roadmap for your solution areas.
  • Are able to articulate competitive differentiation & gaps between Jitterbit solutions and competitors in the iPaaS/APIM markets.
  • Participated in cross-functional go to market team meetings.
  • Have completed your first offering plan, requirements doc, and/or JIRA tickets.
  • Have taken ownership of your solutions area.

In the next 60 days, you will

  • Participated in development planning with the Solutions team.
  • Demonstrate ownership of your Solutions as the primary “go-to” person to answer questions, etc.
  • Independently work with your counterpart in key ecosystems as well as field sales to research, get feedback, answer questions, and provide roadmap guidance in your Solution areas.
  • Are able to create content for internal and external sales & customer enablement.
  • Are able to collaborate with Product Marketing and Marketing to determine messaging, positioning, target personas, etc.

In the next 90 days, you will

  • Develop quarterly Objective Key Results (OKR) targets and execute against them.
  • Demonstrate successful execution of a significant milestone in your Solution area.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate:

  • You have demonstrated experience creating and managing a Solution offering through initial release to market traction.
  • You have demonstrated experience in evaluating markets to determine the best Solution offerings to increase traction and growth in those markets with new or existing products.
  • You have demonstrated experience writing and presenting content to live and virtual audiences including executive & senior leaders.
  • You have demonstrated experience creating a product strategy, presenting it to leadership and executing against that strategy successfully.
  • You have demonstrated domain knowledge in business applications such as Salesforce, NetSuite, Workday, or ServiceNow.
  • You have demonstrated experience in learning new applications and domains to create new offerings.
  • You have demonstrated experience working in a smaller company (200-300 people) and are comfortable in those environments.
  • You have demonstrated, hands-on experience writing requirements, user stories, and tasks in an agile development environment.
  • You have demonstrated, hands-on experience with putting together training and marketing content related to your product.
  • You have demonstrated experience working with a technical product for enterprise, B2B companies.
  • You are curious and do what it takes to be expert in your area.
  • You are comfortable with and enjoy talking with and meeting with people proactively.
  • You can work independently and self-manage.
  • You have demonstrated experience working remotely or with remote teams.
  • You have a strong customer service attitude and can work productively in situations where there may be conflict or emotions.
  • You are comfortable receiving criticism and can be objective about the state of your product or offering.
  • You can operate comfortably in fluid environments where decisions or priorities may change.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Apply for job

2. Schedule posts on Hootsuite.
3. Respond appropriately to comments and customer enquiries via social media.

2. Knows how to grow social media following.

4. Able to use scheduling software (Hootsuite).
5. Flexible, adaptable and able to work on a variety of tasks i.e. testing a website, evaluating a design or proofreading legal documents.
6. Organised and able to keep track of several tasks at once..
7. Willing to help and assist colleagues when required.
8. Self-motivated and able to work remotely

DESIRABLE QUALITIES:
1. Experience of SMM for non-visual brand.
2. Ability to create basic graphics for Instagram using Sketch, Photoshop or equivalent.

items.title: Marketing Analyst
items.content:
Marketing Analyst at UiPath

Remote

New York, NY

Marketing, Marketing – G&A

Accelerate Human Achievement: that is UiPath’s purpose. We are the leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), and with over $400 million in funding from top venture capital firms like Sequoia, Capital G (Google), and Accel, we are on an unprecedented trajectory of growth. With this funding, we have an incredible opportunity to improve the way people work globally.

Our award-winning company culture values humility, and leaders who know how to listen. CEO Daniel Dines’ primary goal was to build a company where he would love to work, and even now, with thousands of employees in tens of countries, that remains our top priority.

We trust and empower our colleagues, and together we make sure we have everything we need to do our best work, from the support of strong leaders to awesome perks and benefits.

The Marketing Analyst will provide analytic and strategic support to UiPath’s Global Marketing team with a full understanding of B2B Marketing tactics, channels, strategies, and the desired business outcomes; including how to measure the key indicators of success. The ability to present data via reports (more details below) and communicate these findings effectively to various internal stakeholders with the primary audience being Regional VP’s is key to success in this function.

The Marketing Analyst will be also responsible for identifying trends in data that may reflect areas for pipeline, messaging/campaign enhancements or possible data integrity issues that allow for accurate analysis. This includes, but is not limited to issues with campaign setup, inaccurate lead flow, system integrations, stale data, etc.

Here’s what you would be doing at UiPath:

  • Use data from multiple sources (Hubspot, Salesforce, Google Analytics 360, Google Search Console, Ad Servers, etc.) to provide key insights on campaign success, marketing channel performance, account penetration, and highlight opportunities for new initiatives
  • Build out dashboards and/or presentations showing a variety of full-funnel metrics across all of the aforementioned systems (and any brought on in the future) through a variety of BI tools (Google Data Studio, Insight Squared, Tableau), Excel or Powerpoint for visualization
  • Strong SQL background for data transformation post ETL process to be able to tailor queries to the business questions at hand
  • Advanced knowledge and usage of analytics offered in SFDC, Hubspot and Google Analytics. Familiarity with other marketing tech stack tools a plus.
  • Architect a tactical, multi-touch demand generation strategy to allow for Regional VP’s to shift their marketing mix strategy using data-backed recommendations
  • Measure the ROI of online and offline advertising campaigns through marketing attribution tools (SFDC, Google Analytics, Custom Models). Understanding of the various inputs needed to create data-driven models is a must.

Here’s what you Bring:

  • Hands-on experience with Salesforce, Google Analytics, Hubspot and/or Marketo in a marketing function
  • History of producing and distributing metrics/insights that help us understand how to drive improvements to our customer acquisition and retention strategies. Ability to effectively communicate insights to C-level and VP-level stakeholders is a must
  • 2+ years of experience with SQL (writing and editing queries, joining disparate data sources). GCP environment exposure a HUGE plus
  • 2+ years experience developing dashboards, reports, and visualization to identify marketing trends that map back to revenue growth
  • Ability to manage workload with a project plan – prioritizing work based on business objectives and communicating status and progress to stakeholders.
  • Exposure to the technical implementation of web conversion tracking (preferably through Google Tag Manager), with a high-level understanding of the moving parts that make this a reality
  • Knowledge of UX and best practices for multivariate testing, with the ability to provide actionable insights into audience behaviors, especially as it relates to a demand generation engine
  • Motivated to work hard in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment to help our growing business and foster a collaborative team culture.
  • Attention to detail is extremely important to this role given the need to provide cross-system analysis and the smallest errors can lead to inaccurate analysis and recommendations

Preferred Experience:

  • Exposure to content management systems, with preferential treatment given toward Sitecore.
  • Experience with statistical analysis of marketing initiatives, or a history of collaboration with data scientists for statistical analysis.
  • Previous exposure to the competitive landscape for Robotic Process Automation (RPA)
  • 2+ years of experience in analytics for a consumer brand and/or a B2B brand marketing space.
  • Experience working with teams in different time zones.
  • *Fully distributed team; local or remote applicants welcomed. United States locale preferred.

At UiPath, we value a range of diverse backgrounds experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes.

Downstream is building software that uses advanced analytics and machine learning to programmatically manage and optimize advertising campaigns on Amazon.com.  The Downstream founders are Amazon veterans from the domains of marketing and software development. 
 
What you will be doing? 

We are seeking a Senior Marketing Manager that will assume end-to-end ownership over Downstream’s marketing strategy. Working directly with our customers and Downstream evangelists, the Senior Marketing Manager will create and publish compelling content for consumer brands and agencies. The ideal candidate is comfortable with ambiguity, highly effective operating with autonomy, and uses data to prioritize the highest return on effort activities. 

  • Produce and publish content, including blog posts, landing pages, newsletters, white papers, videos, and sales collateral, to support awareness, thought leadership, and demand generation efforts 
  • Build and manage a rich content/editorial calendar that attracts a qualified audience to Downstream’s website 
  • Ensure all content is on-brand, consistent in terms of style, quality and tone of voice, and optimized for search.

Own and drive all paid marketing efforts; SEM, Social, events, etc. partnering with Sales to drive acquisition 
Own weekly traffic reporting, measuring and detailing KPIs for all marketing channels

  • Ability to juggle multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment 
  • Strong organization skills and attention to detail 
  • Strong editorial/content background, proofreading skills, and ability to distill complex concepts into simple messages. 
  • Strong bias for action and a proven ability to initiate and drive projects to completion in an ambiguous environment with minimal guidance 

Additional Preferred Qualifications 
  • Experience with SEO and SEM 
  • Experience working remotely and working with remote business and/or technology teams 
  • Experience with startups or software as a service (SaaS) marketing

You are responsible for:

  • Drive business performance according to KPIs such as yearly sales, market shares, Integral Gross Margin (IGM) through price realization in markets, A&P, Integral Sales Margin (ISM) and marketing ROI. Growing top and bottom line with Strategic Ambition.
  • Act as escalation point and advocate with Business for the Markets and vice versa to enable smooth functioning of the BMC.

  • Drives policy-making and key strategic improvement initiatives.
  • Lead business and marketing plans creation, improvement, delivery, and execution with excellence and on time.
  • Viewed as an expert by the company and in the field.
  • Ensure marketing communication/activation planning in the region.
  • Develop end-to-end capabilities in the selected market together with various functions such as product development, supply chain and marketing.
  • Prepare and deliver internal business performance reviews.
  • Define and assist execution of channel distribution strategy.
  • Exchange best in class examples and/or approaches between the region’s markets. Benchmarking with competitions in relevant markets.
  • Lead a cooperative effort across different domains such Global Marketing Team, categories, F&A, SCM and Commercial Organization
  • Identify, define and initiate additional growth initiatives on a global basis

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in healthcare, business or engineering discipline preferred; MBA preferred
  • 10 years in marketing, downstream marketing, product management or related field preferred
  • Proven track record in developing and implementing business plans on a global level working with the full marketing mix and various distribution channels.
  • Expert level knowledge of marketing processes, strategic planning, budgeting and business analytics
  • Experience in high-tech, healthcare/med-tech solutions businesses, strong preference for experience with consumer medical devices
  • Ability to network and influence in a global matrix organization
  • Demonstrated that you can think conceptually from a broad business perspective taking both strategic as well as operational aspects into consideration.
  • Globally fluent, and able to function effectively across cultures
  • Ability to synthesize market and customer feedback to drive valuable innovations
  • Comfortable with making tradeoffs, decisively
  • Expert written, verbal and presentation communication skills and ability to convey complex messages to influence colleagues and executive audiences
  • Expertise delivering complex projects to meet demanding feature, cost, quality and launch targets

In return, we offer you
The opportunity to join our Healthy Sleep Solutions team, a dynamic, ambitious team breaking new ground in the world of consumer sleep. We are a diverse team spread around US, Europe and Asia with the leadership team based in Pittsburgh. We are looking for new team members with an entrepreneurial spirit to help people around the world to live better through sleep.

Philips’ dedication to enriching lives is reflected in our company, our solutions, and a commitment to our people. Philips employees change lives every day.

Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Content Marketing Manager


Enhancv

 verified
At Enhancv, we build the world’s best resume-editing platform. Each month we help thousands of customers worldwide get the job they love. We are a small 10-person team spread across Europe , Asia and North America whose goal is to put an Enhancv resume on every recruiter’s desk!

We are looking for a passionate and results-driven content marketer to grow our organic search traffic. The market is huge and the question is -- are you up for the challenge and ready to roll-up your sleeves?

**Where you'll work**

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it's a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly ✈️ and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that's why we are expanding. Join us in our office in Sofia , or work remotely.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way -- we believe that's how we'll win. And while the sky's the limit, remember you'll also positively change people's lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, Glassdoor, BuzzFeed and other media.

Salary, Benefits & Perks

Work remotely.
Market salary based on location and results you produce.
♂️ 22 days of paid leave.
⚕️ Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.
️♂️ Sports allowance.
Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.
Transport allowance.
✈️ Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.
Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.




# Responsibilities
**Well, here’s what you’ll be doing**

You’ll drive organic traffic to millions of searches per month. Literally. And will be the team expert.
You’ll do it all -- 1️⃣ produce content yourself, 2️⃣ manage 10+ content writers to drive organic acquisition, 3️⃣ ensure team members follow best practises and 4️⃣ monitor and improve content quality.
You’ll be equally responsible for content management and content production.
You’ll work in a competitive industry at a fast pace. Just check our competitors and what they are doing.

# Requirements
**Ideally, you’re no stranger to these**

You’ve scaled to 1M+ views per month with content marketing.
You’ve managed a team of freelancers, writers, or content researchers.
You love to write about things you don’t know the first thing about and can produce content about it in a day or two instead of a week.
Ahrefs, Moz, Semrush and such are not just in your bookmarks. You use them daily to navigate your efforts. You read between the lines (mention your favorite ice-cream flavor in the typical day question of the application to let us know you saw this).
You love content and know the difference between good and bad. You bring evidence and make sure content marketing is done right.

#Salary
$40k-$90k

- Remote

items.title: You Need A Budget (YNAB): Humbly Confident Product Manager

items.content:
Humbly Confident Product Manager

YNAB is growing, and so is our product team. We’re a software ecosystem that includes personal budgeting apps for web, iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, and Android phones. Our mission is to help our users take total control of their money—not just by using an app (if only it were that easy!), but changing habits and ways of thinking.

You’re the one we’re looking for if you’re collaborative, results-oriented, creative, and disciplined. You love solving complex problems both internally and for our users, and know what it means to build a mature, evolving product. You’re customer-centric and have a knack for developing a deep understanding of their needs. You could say the same about understanding the needs a SaaS business like YNAB faces and the larger market landscape, too. You probably organize things in your sleep, and enjoying making sense out of seeming chaos — but you’re also comfortable living in spots where messy is THE place to be. You communicate for a living and you know it, so you understand the language of development and design, marketing and support—and you do it well in all mediums, from face-to-face, to long-form, to comments in a Figma file. You expound on decision-making strategies for too long at summer barbeques, but somehow keep people listening.

Requirements (these are real, actual requirements):

  • You must have at least five years working in the software industry, three of which you've been in the role of a product manager. Complex or data-rich applications are a plus.
  • You must have experience in cross-functional product development. And we really mean that cross-functional part.

That’s a super-brief intro to what you’ll be working on. But first, you need to know if you’ll even like working with us. We think you will.

A Bit About Us

We build YNAB (or “You Need a Budget” if you have a lot of extra time on your hands), the best budgeting software around. For more than a decade, people have been buying YNAB and then telling their friends what a difference it has made in their lives. (Google us, or read some of our reviews on the app store, and you’ll see what we mean.) We love building something that has a huge positive impact on people’s lives.

We’re profitable, bootstrapped, and growing. YNAB started in 2004 and we haven’t taken any outside funding—we’re in it for the long haul.

We have one overarching requirement when it comes to joining our team: our originalCultural Manifesto has to really click with you. If you’re nodding emphatically while reading it, you’ll probably fit right in, in which case, we can’t wait to hear from you!

First, let’s talk about life at YNAB and then we’ll go into detail about what we’re looking for.

Who you'd be working with:

We’re talking product manager here, so you’d be working with a lot of different people. We can’t even list them all, really.

You’ll be reporting to Todd, our Chief Product Officer. He obsesses about continuously improving our products and the experiences they enable—especially any magic to make YNAB simpler to adopt and more powerful in the long run, too. He’ll have any conversation where he has the chance to learn something, loves greyscale to an irrational extent, and enjoys ideas for their own sake. He likes long gaps of silence and very loud music, running ultramarathons, and wants to disappear someday to make hand-crafted furniture.

And as we said above, you’ll also cross paths with--well--probably everyone else. People like Buffy and Sebastian (a couple of our developers), Alan (a designer), and Angela (our Director of Customer Support). Also, our other new product manager, who we haven’t met yet, either.

How You'll Work at YNAB

We work really hard to make working at YNAB an amazing experience. We have a team full of truly exceptional people—the kind you’ll be excited to work with. Here’s how we operate:

Live Where You Want

We’re a distributed team, so you can live and work wherever you want. Proximity doesn’t influence productivity. Taylor, our CTO, was traveling who-knows-where for a couple of years before he bought a farm. Up and move to France for a year? Sure, Todd did that. Don’t like France? How about London, where Janelle trotted off to. Tulsa Remote? Can do. Or if you just love LA or Baltimore or Buenos Aires, we’ve got people there, too.  Not all of us move around, but the fact that these folks have is totally okay because we’re all adults. Just make sure you have a reliable internet connection.

No Crazy Hours

We rarely work more than 40 hours per week. There have been a few occasions where things got a little crazy and people had to log some extra hours. But then they took some extra time off, so it all balances out. We work hard and smart but we’re in this for the long haul, no need to go crazy on the hours.

Take Vacation (Seriously)

We want you to take vacation. In fact, we have a minimum vacation policy of three weeks per year. Five weeks feels about right (plus two extra weeks for Holiday break). It’s important to get out and do something. We’ll look forward to seeing pictures of your vacation in our internal chat room, creatively named #office_wall.

The YNAB Meetup

We get the teams together once a year to catch up on spreadsheets and powerpoints in a Best Western conference room. Just kidding. So far, we’ve done Costa Rica, a gigantic cabin in the mountains, a beach house in the Outer Banks, a ranch in Montana, and took over a hotel on Laguna Beach. We do really fun things, but the highlight always seems to be just hanging out together and having a blast.

Up Your Game

We’re serious about helping you improve your craft. We budget for it (hey-o!). Think conferences, online courses and subscriptions, dedicated time away from work to learn something new… it’s really up to you and your manager. But we love to see our people growing.  

International is Absolutely Okay

If you are Stateside, we’ll set you up as a W2 employee. If you’re international, you’ll be set up as a contractor. Employee or contractor, it’s all the same to us. You’re part of the team. (We are spread all over the world: Switzerland, Scotland, Mexico, Brazil, Argentina, Germany, Canada, and all over the United States.)

If You’re Stateside…

You’ll be a W2 employee with fantastic health, dental, and vision insurance, where we cover 100% of the premium for you and your family. (No need to check your vision, you read that right, 100%. Although if you did need to check your vision, no big deal, we’ve got you covered!)

We also have a Traditional and Roth 401k option. YNAB contributes three percent whether you choose to throw any money in there or not. It vests immediately. (Are you a personal finance junkie like our founder Jesse? He set up YNAB’s 401k to have the lowest fee structure possible, where all plan costs are paid by YNAB, not your retirementnest egg. The investment funds available are fantastic, passively-managed, ultra low-cost index funds. You’re not a PF junkie? Trust us, it’s awesome.

Other Tidbits

  • Once you start, we DEMAND (in a friendly, ALL CAPS IS YELLING way) that you fill out your “Bucket List” spreadsheet with 50 items. (That’s harder than it sounds!)
  • The bucket list really helps in deciding what we should give you for your birthday and Christmas: No gift cards here. We tried that. Super boring.
  • We have a bonus plan based on profitability. You’ll be in on that from day one. YNAB wins, you win. That kind of thing.
  • We’re all adults. There’s no need to punch a clock, or ask for permission to take off early one afternoon to go see the doctor (health insurance premium 100% covered!). We look at what you accomplish, not how long you sit (have you tried standing?) in front of a computer.
  • We want you firing on all cylinders so we’ll set you up with a shiny new computer and replace it every three years.
  • Did I mention we make a huge, positive difference in people’s lives? You may not think that matters much, but then a few months down the road you’ll realize it’s made your job really, really enjoyable. Don’t underestimate this one!

If this sounds like your ideal environment, read on because now I want to talk about you. You will play a big, big part in helping YNAB customers achieve success. You will change lives. I’ll only say that six more times.

Now, back to you, our new Product Manager...


What Success Looks Like:

At YNAB, our goal is for every user to achieve life-changing financial control. No small thing, right? In 2019, we’ll focus intensely on making YNAB effortless and helping new budgeters get started effectively, from their very first experience...Success means you get the best ideas and the best outcomes out of our cross-functional teams, and regularly ship real value to our users.

You’ll also help us develop systems and processes to more efficiently deliver top-notch, dare we say life-changing, experiences to our users. We’ve been growing. A lot. And that means an evolving product structure—you’ll work closely with Todd, our CPO, and with another new-to-YNAB product manager to continue building that structure out, blending the best of who we are with who we can be.

You’ll need to:

  • Understand the user journey, not just as they use our apps, but in the real world as they seek to take control of their financial lives.
  • Understand deeply that “cross-functional” isn’t code at YNAB for “designers and engineers.” We’ve doubled down on our best ideas coming from anywhere, and Support, Marketing, and Education are equal members of our flat product teams.
  • Along those lines, you’ll learn the design principles and financial logic of our apps like the back of your hand. You’ll learn our engineering processes like the back of your other hand. Then you’ll find another hand or three for internalizing our brand, marketing strategies and support ethic.
  • Shepherd your team’s work from discovery to ideation to release to follow-up (because you know how much product work happens after release), documenting decisions the team has made along the way. In particular, you’ll work hand-in-hand with a product designer on your team to jointly develop vision, prioritize, and execute on strategy.
  • Synthesize and make sense of ALL THE DATA and information about our products, for yourself and to help others across the organization make better decisions. You’re fluent in quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis.
  • Be comfortable with multiple discovery techniques and strategies in your quest to make YNAB consistently better. You enjoy talking to customers in user interviews and usability testing. You have a knack for summarizing research in a concise way to share with teammates.
  • Communicate, explain, persuade, explore and otherwise get all the things done in writing. Yes, we like talking to each other, but as a remote team, much of our collaboration is asynchronous and written.
  • You’re intensely curious. Period.
  • Oh, also, not to the exclusion of anything else, but you’re intensely curious about how people learn, how they change and develop habits, and how behavior inside a product might change behavior outside it.
  • You’re comfortable speaking the language of software development and product design. If you’re also comfortable diving into HTML and CSS (or even one of the programming languages in our development stack!), that’s a plus, but it’s not a requirement. Conversant across all disciplines is key.
  • Be a curious, persistent, and a quick learner, staying ahead of new ideas, technologies and other opportunities to help YNAB users take total control of their money, even sleep better at night.
  • Manage key partner relationships, from day-to-day communication to contract negotiation and management.

Finally, your success as a product manager at YNAB hinges upon your ability to approach product development as holistic simultaneous problem solving of both user and business goals. We work collaboratively here so you’ll listen to ideas, questions, and critiques from teammates with grace and patience. That said, you know your stuff and can eloquently and logically explain decisions. You see this type of exchange as critical to the success of yourself and our users: It is through sharing ideas and being open to the brilliance of others that we arrive at the best solutions.

And, since our job descriptions are already so long, what’s another sentence or two…

YNAB is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and experiences to be critical to our success and are passionate about creating a welcoming, supportive, and collaborative environment for all employees. All are encouraged to apply as we continue to grow a smart, hard-working, and diverse team who love working together to build something that matters.

How to Apply

  • Apply here (https://ynab.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0j9pz) by 11:59PM on June 23rd, 2019. Firm. It’s a real deadline. Like, after it is too late.
  • Attach a pdf of your cover letter. In your cover letter:
  • >>>Introduce yourself and explain why this position is of interest to you, and why you would be a great fit.
  • >>>We love someone with a perspective about product development. Tell us, in one paragraph, about the difference between a good mistake and a bad mistake.
  • >>>Include the word “mistake” somewhere in your cover letter
  • If you have a prepared resume, attach it in PDF form. If you don’t have a resume because you aren’t even sure you’re looking to change jobs, that’s fine! An informal list of your work and education history are all we’re looking for.

P.S.  If you’re not interested in or available for this position, but know someone who might be, we would really appreciate it if you passed this along!

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
items.content:
The property industry is broken and we’re fixing it. The Housing Crisis is an issue which has an effect on all of us. We’re helping to make a systemic change in the property industry, using our software to make the sector more dynamic, transparent, and efficient.

About the company

LandInsight is a new platform that is fundamentally changing how the property industry buys land for development. It’s a big data platform that speeds up the process of finding, assessing and buying land. It comes at an important time, one of the biggest challenges for the UK housing crisis is tackling the shortage of development land. Our tech has changed the game and as a result we’ve become the UK’s fastest growing PropTech company (and we’ve got the awards to prove it!).

People are taking notice too - our user base is doubling regularly and already, tens of thousands of homes have been built on sites that were sourced using LandInsight, and that’s just the beginning.

To support and accelerate this growth we’re looking for ambitious, creative and collaborative people to join the LandInsight family.

Our culture

Our values are ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’ and we regularly hold ourselves accountable to these. The people who work here feel that they are challenged, but also feel like they have the environment and tools to succeed.

We truly believe that businesses flourish when people work collaboratively. That’s why we prioritise team building and facilitation. We are in constant contact with the company founders, so are able to learn about the conception of and running of a tech startup that is scaling. We run weekly sessions to ensure every voice is heard and empowered to grow and contribute.

We don’t just make empty gestures about our culture - we were voted as the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work at, and have also received awards for ‘Diversity Advocate’ and ‘Best at Employee Development’.


Your mission

As LandInsight’s first product marketer your mission is to communicate the unique value our products provide. You’ll be in charge of driving feature adoption and making sure the world knows about the great tools we’re building.

By defining our message, distilling features into benefits, leading launches and making sure the whole company rallies behind the same ideas, you’ll play a key part in taking LandInsight to new heights.

Ultimately, your goal is to supercharge LandInsight’s growth by bringing new users to our platform and making sure they see the benefits of staying with us for many years to come.

Responsibilities

- Define LandInsights product messaging and positioning
- Demonstrate the benefits of our products to various target audiences
Plan and execute product launches, synchronising launch calendars & timelines between the Product & Marketing Teams
- Provide Sales and Customer Success with the information they need to effectively communicate with prospects and users
- Coordinate with the rest of the Marketing Team to create product materials, including product videos, presentations, case studies, email campaigns, website copy and more
- Analyse the effectiveness of product marketing initiatives across the user life cycle

Essential criteria

- 3 years of product marketing experience
- Analytical mind and strong quantitative skills
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Experience in creating educational content
- Experience of planning and executing on product launch plans
- Understanding of different marketing disciplines, e.g. content, social media, SEO, paid, email etc.

Desirable criteria

- Experience in market analysis
- Knowledge of Hubspot and Drift
- Experience of video marketing
- Previous experience in the property industry

Why work for us?

- Flexible working hours
- Professional and personal training budget
- Competitive salary and equity options
- 25 days paid holiday (additional to bank holidays)
- Unlimited unpaid holidays
- Dog friendly office
- Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day, an annual ski trip and monthly socials
- Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
- Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a beer/glass of prosecco with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

It’s a big data platform that speeds up the process of finding, assessing and buying land. It comes at an important time, one of the biggest challenges for the UK housing crisis is tackling the shortage of development land. Our tech has changed the game and as a result we’ve become the UK’s fastest growing PropTech company (and we’ve got the awards to prove it!).

People are taking notice too - our user base is doubling regularly and already, tens of thousands of homes have been built on sites that were sourced using LandInsight, and that’s just the beginning.

To support and accelerate this growth we’re looking for ambitious, creative and collaborative people to join the LandInsight family.

Our culture

Our values are ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’ and we regularly hold ourselves accountable to these. The people who work here feel that they are challenged, but also feel like they have the environment and tools to succeed.

We truly believe that businesses flourish when people work collaboratively. That’s why we prioritise team building and facilitation. We are in constant contact with the company founders, so are able to learn about the conception of and running of a tech startup that is scaling. We run weekly sessions to ensure every voice is heard and empowered to grow and contribute.

We don’t just make empty gestures about our culture - we were voted as the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work at, and have also received awards for ‘Diversity Advocate’ and ‘Best at Employee Development’.


Your mission

We are looking for a passionate Product Manager / Senior Product Manager to lead our flagship product, LandInsight - a tool that helps property developers understand the development potential of any plot of land in seconds. You will be the evangelist for LandInsight, take end to end ownership of the product strategy, and oversee its delivery. From research to definition, stakeholder management to design and delivery, you will design and build a product that delights our customers.

Responsibilities

- You’ll be laser-focussed on our customers and form a deep understanding of their needs. You’ll know more about our customers than anyone else in the business.
- You will be a strategist who will set the product’s high-level vision and direction, and turn it into actionable tasks.
- You’ll ensure LandInsight helps us meet our company-wide strategy, have a clear picture of the competitive landscape, and be commercially minded.
- You’ll be deeply analytical, with the ability to turn data into insight and insight into action. You will lead our tracking and visibility of product metrics, undertake robust user research, and challenge assumptions
- You will be a consummate team player, adept at managing relationships, collaborating and influencing across the whole business.
- You will help us develop an efficient product development process by identifying and removing roadblocks to realise product milestones. You will manage the product backlog, write user stories, and lead sprint planning and scoping sessions
- You will be excited about working in a rapidly growing and ever-changing environment

Essential criteria

- A proven track record of delivering a best in breed B2B SaaS product
- Experience managing a team
- You are results-orientated, a self-starter, with the ability to juggle several projects at once
- Excellent communication skills

Desirable criteria

- Experience in PropTech, design and coding skills are not required, but very beneficial!

Why work for us?

- Flexible working hours
- Professional and personal training budget
- Competitive salary and equity options
- 25 days paid holiday (additional to bank holidays)
- Unlimited unpaid holidays
- Dog friendly office
- Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day, an annual ski trip and monthly socials
- Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
- Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a beer/glass of prosecco with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

Wanted: Talent Relations Associate That Loves Bees

Wanted: Talent Relations Associate That Loves Bees


Technically, you don’t have to love bees to get this job. But if bees are your thing, that’s cool too - we don’t judge.

Who Are We?

Now that you know we’re not bee obsessed weirdos, you probably want to get to know us a little better (and we’re glad you do!).

Be My Guest is a podcast PR and production agency for entrepreneurs, CEO’s, and experts from all walks of life.

We serve our clients by booking them as guests on podcasts that reach their ideal customers and readers so they can get more publicity, grow their audience, and drive the sales of their products and services.

What We Need

Main Goal: A self-driven and proactive human who meshes well with our ambitious and fun team.

Stretch Goal: The above + someone who gives Ron Burgundy his due respect.

You’ll be helping our clients grow their businesses through podcast guest appearances (these interviews will be listened to by thousands of people).

This is a client facing role (after an initial training period), so having a way with words via email, phone, and handwritten letters is a must.

Specifically, you will help us with:

  • Outreach & Pitching - Craft personal and compelling email, video, and social media pitches to podcast hosts in order to obtain guest appearances for our clients on their show (don’t worry - we have a system we’ll teach you)
  • Client Management - Correspond with clients about new interviews you have booked for them, answer any questions they might have, and ensure we are delivering on the results we have guaranteed them
  • Project Management- Keeping our project management systems up to date (Trello/Asana/HubSpot) in real-time so we can best track client deliverables
  • Random Acts of Kindness - Sending handwritten notes + gifts to podcasters and clients

The Starting Line

  • You take pride in creating engaging, creative, and persuasive pitch emails (this will be your primary duty in this role)
  • You have an upbeat, bubbly, and friendly personality that shines through virtual communication. We’re a company run by young, talented, and fun individuals. If you don’t laugh at a good meme or get sarcasm we may not be a great fit.
  • You’re a good human (if you’ve ever kicked an animal that wasn’t attacking you or cursed at a homeless person please don’t apply).
  • On more than one occasion people (not your parents) have complimented how proactive you are.
  • You have internal motivation (we’re a fully remote company that does not micromanage).
  • Must live in the United States.

The Finish Line

  • You are coachable and ego doesn’t get in your way (you’re happy doing high-level projects as well as mundane administrative tasks).
  • You can balance multiple projects at the same time (attention to detail test - use the word "apple" somewhere in your application).
  • You know the inner workings of Gmail, Google Calendar, and Google Docs in a way that others may find disturbing.
  • You manage confidentiality without exception. You will be required to sign an NDA, as our client's privacy is very important to us.

The Victory Lap

  • You have experience managing deliverables for multiple clients at once.
  • You’re familiar with Trello, Asana, and/or HubSpot.
  • You’re a podcast fan.

Let’s Talk Benefits & Logistics

  • While we do get together in-person occasionally, we’re primarily a remote company. You can work anywhere you want - from your house, favorite coffee shop, co-working space, etc. :)
  • This is a full-time 40 hour per week contract position that requires the majority of your workday be completed during standard business hours.
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Monthly remote work stipend

Let’s Do This Thing

To apply for this position, please use this link: https://be-my-guest.workable.com/

items.content:
Overview
Unmind is transforming mental health in the workplace. We have developed a market-leading digital platform, secured funding from top-tier investors, and signed contracts with a variety of global corporations… but we’re just getting started.

We have humongous plans –and need lots of help in achieving them– which is why we’re looking for an exceptional individual to join as our first content person to lead Unmind’s content marketing efforts moving forward.

About Unmind
Unmind is a workplace mental health platform – providing clinically-backed tools, training, and assessments that anyone can use to proactively improve their mental wellbeing. Our digital platform is beautifully designed, non-stigmatising and globally scalable – helping to create healthier, happier, more human organisations around the world.

We believe that everyone has the right to a healthy mind –because we all have mental health, all of the time– and we’re striving to create a world where mental health is universally understood, nurtured, and celebrated.

The Role – Content Marketing Manager
As a team of thirty-six, everyone does a bit of everything and we’re a SUPER flat organisation –all opinions are valued regardless of role, tenure or background– so every aspect of the business is up for debate. That said, the core remit of this particular role is to:

Lead our content strategy, driving customer acquisition, activation and retention.
Fully conceptualise, write, and edit engaging content.
Leverage our existing relationships - clients and contributors - to add credibility.
Craft and own our tone of voice.
Ensure quality and consistency across different channels including online and events.
Ensure that all efforts are highly organised and systematically tracked.
Refine our schedule to align with key events, new research and product launches.
Optimise your output, considering SEO and Google Analytics.
Work with Design, Client Success and Sales to identify opportunities and deliver your vision.
Contribute to our wider communications strategy inc. PR relationships etc.
Grow Unmind into a global thought leader that is truly loved!

Responsibilities
We are looking for someone to lead Unmind’s content marketing activities. To-date most of our content has been written by different members of the Unmind team, but we feel that now is the right time to scale our efforts, professionalise our approach, and grow Unmind into a global thought leader.

This role will require working incredibly closely in collaboration with our Head of Marketing as well as our Sales and Client Success teams to ensure we are always aligned and working towards the same overarching objectives. The successful candidate will be extremely bright, unwaveringly candid, and bring oodles of insight to the table. If you’re ambitious, creative and articulate, then this is an opportunity to oversee all-things content marketing at a fast-growth, high-impact startup.

Here’s how your skills and passion will come to life at Unmind:

Build: Design, develop, and deliver Unmind’s content marketing strategy. This will include (but is not limited to): content creation and deployment; tone of voice and positioning; optimising SEO and discoverability whilst tracking progress.
Redefine: Transform the world’s perception of mental health. Unmind is changing the landscape of mental healthcare, and your input will play an enormous role in how we achieve that. You will need to create effective content that elevates the subject whilst ensuring that we always uphold our core values.
Collaborate: Harness the kaleidoscope of personal stories and professional expertise from across the Unmind team to inspire others around our mission/vision/purpose. Work with our phenomenal clients, users and collaborators to leverage their shared passion, testimonials, and insights around improving workplace mental health.
Implement: Instill analytics and reporting around all content initiatives to enhance business predictability and transparency. Help define, track and manage company KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) associated with content marketing.
Reflect: Review all content and communication activity to-date, retrospectively looking for opportunities or improvements that will enhance efficiency/effectiveness. Compile periodic reporting and insights from ongoing content efforts to aid internal planning and enhance our collective understanding of what is/isn’t striking a chord with the market.
Partner: Proactively connect with early-adopters, industry experts, and thought-leaders within the market to ensure that our messaging is always striking the right chord.
Grow: We love working with people who are naturally curious and always seek opportunities to learn. We have a hugely experienced team but none of us think we are the finished article. You shall expect to be challenged and to challenge others internally. We are striving to create something truly special so egos need to be left at the door.


Skills and Experience
As with any B2B organisation, the success of Unmind depends on every member of staff being professional, amicable, and building strong relationships – both internally and with external stakeholders. Our ideal candidate traits are as follows:


ESSENTIAL:

3+ years of content marketing experience – ideally within a tech-led enterprise environment.
Experience building a successful B2B enterprise content marketing strategy.
Ability to leverage a network of clients/experts/ambassadors.
A love for storytelling, and a natural ability to engage customers and prospects.
Exceptional writing, editing, and verbal communications skills.
Excellent editorial and copywriting abilities, including long form and short form content.
Ability and willingness to source knowledge and research topics independently.
Understand the B2B marketing funnel, including the customer's journey.
Creative, innovative and have an eye for detail.
Autonomous attitude (you *do not* require (or like) micro-management).
An ability to simplify, communicate, and sell ideas to multiple groups of stakeholders, with a relentless enthusiasm to over-deliver on targets and expectations.
Bona. Fide. Hustler. If it needs doing, you’ll get it done - somehow, some way.
Hungry to make Unmind the global category leader within workplace mental health.
Not a terrible human being… Ideally a great one. We’re a tight team and want to stay that way.

DESIRED:
Passion for mental health, tech-for-good, and generally improving people’s lives.
Prior role(s) within a B2B SaaS environment and/or HR Tech experience.
Previous startup and/or entrepreneurial experience (inc. being innovative with resources!)
Comfortable working for a small, rapid growth business with constant change/unknowns.
Bonus points for expertise in video production, graphic design, or website management.
Passionate about design, UX and beautiful brands.

The Opportunity
You will be joining an exceptionally talented core team who –in the last 24-months– have secured incredible investors, partners, clients and advocates. Our future success(es) will rely on the continuation of that momentum – of which our ability to enhance (and leverage) Unmind’s market presence will be paramount. If done right, then the opportunity for this individual (and Unmind generally) is vast, compounded and –perhaps most importantly– will genuinely improve people’s lives.

Location: Unmind’s London office (London Bridge / Borough)

Benefits
Great colleagues (personally and professionally)
Pick your own tech
Regular social company gatherings
Optional team walks, runs and mindfulness sessions
Wellbeing budget to use at your discretion
Office perks (free on-site gym, rooftop bar, wellbeing events)
A culture of continuous learning
Pension and generous holiday policy
Dog-friendly workplace

Job description

User Experience (UX) Research Lead

Location: Flexible, within the United States (Boston, MA or Eastern Time Zone preferred)

Position is available: Immediately

THE OPPORTUNITY

As User Experience (UX) Research Lead, you will work collaboratively with Product Managers, Engineers, and stakeholders across ANet’s National and Regional teams to craft an exceptional end user experience that maximizes the impact of our technology in service to educators and students. This is both a strategic and tactical role with the opportunity to partner with leaders across ANet to identify research needs and influence product and design decisions. This role reports to the Vice President of Product.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Establish ANet’s product research and UX practice in pursuit of maximizing the impact, effectiveness, and ease of use of our educator and student-facing tools
  • Guide product research throughout the product life-cycle from early stage generative research, through iterative UI testing and post-launch measurement
  • Deliver actionable and relevant product research insights (via user interviews, usability studies, focus groups, surveys, etc.) aligned to both strategic and tactical product and designs decisions
  • Manage the information architecture, user interface, and interaction flow of our educator and student-facing products
  • Create low and high-fidelity wireframes and mockups to facilitate product discovery research and development
  • In partnership with Product Managers, develop user personae, customer journey maps, conceptual diagrams, wireframes, and prototypes in support of our product roadmap
  • Build strong empathy and advocate passionately for our end users, ensuring that the product experience is aligned to user needs and expectations
  • Continually iterate and evolve the way we design for and learn from our customers

WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU BRING

In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following:

  • You have a passionate commitment to and a sense of urgency for the support of schools, along with a belief that all students can achieve at high levels
  • You are motivated by working in an environment where we live out our core values daily. You are eager to examine personal archetypes and biases while discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege which relate to ANet’s Advance Equity and People Matter values, and our work towards becoming an anti-racist organization
  • You’ve got about 5 years of hands-on experience and a track record of success with user experience design, information architecture, and product research for digital products
  • You know how to champion a UX research function and act as a customer advocate; you’ve translated research into actionable insights and recommendations that have had a significant impact on the customer experience
  • You have exceptional project management skills and are able to effectively manage multiple complex projects with competing deadlines while working cross-team and synthesizing feedback and input from product management, engineering, and marketing functions
  • You know how to weave key insights into a compelling narrative; your presentation and persuasion skills have led to success in building buy-in from leaders - whether in a formal presentation or via ad-hoc discussions - for bold ideas
  • You have expertise creating prototypes at various levels of fidelity to articulate and test user flows using modern tools (e.g., InVision, Keynote, etc), interaction and visual design documents, user stories, conceptual models, annotated wireframes, storyboards, creative briefs—and more
  • You can demonstrate fluency in best practices for web-based and mobile information architecture and responsive design, as well as deep and broad knowledge of usability principles and techniques
  • You’re always willing to roll up your sleeves and do what is necessary to meet team goals and effectively deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • You have a strong portfolio of UX/UI design work demonstrating your experience working on digital projects from concept to launch

 Ideal candidates may also demonstrate the following preferred qualifications:

  • You bring prior experience in K-12 education or Ed Tech
  • You have studied UX research, digital design, graphic design, and/or human-computer interaction
  • You have working knowledge of human-centered design principles (e.g. Design Thinking) and agile/lean software development
  • You have a proven ability in a variety of design tools such as InDesign, Sketch, Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, and prototyping tools (Invision, Axure, Framer, etc.)

WHAT WE OFFER

ANet offers highly competitive compensation based on prior experience and qualifications as well as comprehensive benefits in order to best support our people. Benefits we offer include: health, dental and vision insurance where ANet pays 80% of the cost of these benefits for employees and their families/domestic partner; 3 weeks of vacation (4 weeks after two years with ANet); 10 paid holidays with paid days off between the Christmas and New Year’s holidays; a paid floating holiday; paid sick & personal days; paid parental leave; retirement plan options; commuter benefits; tuition reimbursement;  flexible spending accounts; short and long-term disability coverage; and basic life and personal accident insurance.

HOW TO APPLY

We are now accepting applications for this position, which will be reviewed on a rolling basis.  To apply, please click on the “Apply” button.  You will then be prompted to complete a brief application and upload a resume and thoughtful cover letter in which you outline why you are interested in working for ANet and how your skills and experience meet the qualifications of the position.

ANet is committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds and gender identities to apply to our positions.

Apply now

About Achievement Network

WHO WE ARE

Every student deserves opportunities in life, and every educator committed to providing those opportunities, deserves support. Those beliefs drive us to work alongside schools to support great teaching so that we can work towards guaranteeing that all students are receiving high quality instruction. We partner with over 900 schools - both district and charter - in underserved communities around the country, thus impacting more than 330,000 students. Third-party evaluations confirm that when schools have the right basic conditions in place and partner with ANet, they achieve 6-8 months of additional learning over a two-year period compared to schools not partnering with ANet.

At ANet we are committed to living out our core values, both across our organization and with our partner schools. We acknowledge that systemic inequities impact student access to opportunities and that in order to ensure educational equity for all students, we must center on the experiences of those from marginalized communities to guide our work. We work to deepen our understanding of how race, class, power and privilege influence the education system as well as influence our own perspectives. To do so,  we provide ongoing learning opportunities through org-wide professional development, affinity groups, working groups, and resource sharing.

Individuals who join ANet have the opportunity to be part of a dynamic, values driven, and team-oriented organization that is committed to having impact in schools by investing in each other and learning together. We were named for the third year in a row as The NonProfit Times' “Best Nonprofits to Work For” and work tirelessly to foster a working environment where the unique perspectives, backgrounds, and identities of our staff members are valued. Among the multiple awards and recognitions, ANet received the highest ratings (Tier 1) of all organizations from the Louisiana Department of Education on our math and ELA formative assessments.

ANet offers highly competitive compensation based on prior experience and qualifications as well as comprehensive benefits in order to best support our people. Benefits we offer include: health, dental and vision insurance where ANet pays 80% of the cost of these benefits for employees and their families/domestic partner; 3 weeks of vacation (4 weeks after two years with ANet); 10 paid holidays with paid days off between the Christmas and New Year’s holidays; a paid floating holiday; paid sick & personal days; paid parental leave; retirement plan options; commuter benefits; tuition reimbursement;  flexible spending accounts; short and long-term disability coverage; and basic life and personal accident insurance.

Product Marketing Manager

What you’ll be contributing to:

At SmashFly, you’ll help us build the future of talent mobility. We’ve set our sights on becoming the next HubSpot, Marketo, or Pardot for recruiting — a platform purpose-built to help large enterprise organizations develop real connections with talent throughout their career lifecycle.

What we’ve created is truly best-in-class software that helps companies attract and proactively build relationships with today’s top talent — from someone’s first interaction with a brand through their first day of retirement. Our solution is used by some of the world’s biggest brands (you probably bank with, buy from, and use some of their products) — and we need talent like you to help us constantly improve our technology for them.

You’re an ideal match if:

You’re eager to be a part of a team that turns concepts, ideas, and idealistic solutions into real, functioning facets of SmashFly’s platform. You thrive in an agile environment. You don’t mind a little bit of uncertainty and can toe the line between strategic thinking and tactical execution. You love to create and control your own destiny. And you’re inspired by the mission to help candidates find their dream jobs — and companies find their dream hires.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Working hand-in-hand with our Product, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success organizations to manage and execute the product launch process from start to finish.
  • Providing competitive intelligence to the product and sales/customer success teams.
  • Creating enablement tools and collateral for the marketing, sales, and customer success teams.
  • Working closely with our VP of Marketing and CMO to bring SmashFly’s product message to analysts, customers, and strategic partners.
  • Leveraging tools like Crayon, competitive win/loss reviews, and other market intelligence mediums to create battlecards and competitive analyses on key competitors.
  • Serving as SmashFly’s internal (and external) messenger on new product features — focusing specifically on what they do and why they matter.
  • Defining and executing SmashFly’s product marketing strategy — you’ll have a lot of autonomy to help us shape what that looks like.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 3+ years experience in B2B SaaS marketing or a product marketing role for a complex consumer organization.
  • Experience planning and rolling out new product launches and working directly with the product team to convert user stories, use cases, product functionality, and technical documentation into internal / external messaging and collateral.
  • Passion for working closely with customers, partners, and other vendors to develop a comprehensive analysis of the market and deliver key go-to-market intelligence to the product, marketing, and sales organizations.
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite, PowerPoint, and other design tools to create product collateral and tools for the sales/customers success teams to use externally.

A little bit about us:

  • We are a growth-mode software startup backed by well-respected venture capital
  • We’ve delivered significant year-on-year growth since our founding — including our best Q1 on record in Q1 2019
  • We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Boston Business Journal
  • We’re the top ranked company in Boston by Glassdoor
  • We offer great benefits including an open vacation policy, stock options, weekly happy hours, and an inclusive, supportive culture that creates clear opportunity for career growth — basically, all the stuff that really matters to top talent like you.

    • About Us

    Goodwall is the leading professional development network for the next generation. We guide young talent as they navigate the future of learning and earning, starting in high school and following along through the college years. Students have a medium to tell their story, get support from our inspirational community, and get connected to universities, internships, and jobs. Our top-rated app has a following of over 1 million members and our network of organizations and companies spans four continents. We are a fast growing and well-financed company that takes great pride in (and thoroughly enjoy) having a diverse team and being an equal opportunity employer. Each member of our dynamic team has a unique perspective to share–just as we know you do–and we are all incredibly passionate about our shared mission and goal: to help every member of our community become the best version of themselves.

    About The Role

    We are looking for an experienced Sr. Product Manager to own the Goodwall product roadmap across our small, global team (NYC, Geneva, and Manila). This is a remote role which may require occasional travel to our Geneva and NYC offices. You’ll be the main intersection between our COO, Engineering and Design teams with a focus on overall product priorities and strategy. We have some pretty exciting ideas on deck and you’ll be responsible for taking them through our agile product development process all the way from ideation to launch and validation. You will work closely with our engineers, designers and business stakeholders, keeping communication flowing and all teams on task. If you are looking for an opportunity to have full responsibility for defining a product from A-Z, this is the role for you!

    What You’ll Do

    • Manage new product features from inception/ideation through to implementation and then on to launch, validation, evaluation and refinement
    • Work very closely with the design department and engineers in product discovery and validation
    • As a product expert, you’ll act as an advocate for users within the company
    • Constantly monitor user feedback, user behavior (qualitatively and quantitatively), competitors and market trends
    • Work with the rest of the Product team in defining the product strategy and roadmap
    • Act as both the user and business representative on the development team during the implementation phase

    What We Offer You

    • A challenging, fast-moving environment
    • Professional growth stipends and opportunities
    • A mission that you can be proud of
    • Ability to have real impact both in the company and on society
    • A high level of autonomy in a position that will evolve according to your strengths
    • Many growth opportunities as the company is growing very quickly
    • A flexible work environment: we are open to candidates located in any location, with a preference in Switzerland or Central Europe

    About You

    • You’re a team player who can effectively lead without direct authority. You know the best way to build influence and credibility with all the members of the team
    • 5+ years experience in a similar Product role
    • Your passion for product easily inspires others
    • You know the mindset of the American culture and can use that knowledge to help us build great products for companies and college students in the US
    • You know your way around an agile product organization with a mobile product
    • You’re confident in your abilities to write and communicate user stories
    • Understanding of good vs. bad UX is second nature to you
    • You’re a talented juggler; you are constantly on the ball and enjoy having multiple points of contact
    • You realize how important both short-term and long-term planning are to reaching your product goals
    • You’ve got experience in data-driven product management, using experimentation and validation as part of the product process
    • You’re not just the Product Manager, but also the Project Manager: you can efficiently orchestrate all the moving pieces of the project and have excellent communication skills to keep the wheels of progress turning at all times
    • We’re a global team made up of many nationalities but English is our company language so you should be able to communicate fluently and effectively in English
    • Previous experience working remotely is a plus

    Diversity & Inclusion

    Goodwall is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to continuing to build a company that embraces and thrives on diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Write Landing Pages and Product Descriptions for B2B Packaging and Materials Supplier (3 to 5 cents per word)

Company: eZdia Inc
Location: Work from home - anywhere
Job Type: Freelance

Description

We create high-level copy for some of the largest ecommerce companies around the world, and we're currently seeking experienced freelance writers and editors.

We have an immediate need for writers and editors for our B2B Packaging projects:

Project 1 consists of writing and/or editing 300-word landing page copy.

Project 2 consists of writing and/or editing 150-word product descriptions.

For both projects, we'll be writing for enterprise-level customers, with our client selling bottles, jars, and other product packaging. While you don't have to be in the industry to do this work, experience with ecommerce writing and solid researching skills will help!

What's a landing page? It's a webpage that showcases a particular category of products; for this project, it would be things like mason jars, amber glass bottles, or childproof pharmaceutical packaging. Our job is to write copy that will appear at the top of bottom of the page to help shoppers learn about the products: what they are, general features and/or benefits, what they need to know when making a purchase, etc.

What's a product description? It's website copy that describes a specific product. It's generally broken up into paragraph copy and 3-5 bullets. Its purpose is to introduce a shopper to the product's particular features and benefits. Unlike category page content that might focus on amber glass jars in general, a product description will focus on a specific product, such as a 4-ounce straight-sided amber glass jar.

We have a full style guide available that explains everything more clearly and can answer any questions you have, so don't worry if you're unsure or confused about what we're looking for.

We need people who:

-- Are fluent in English as their first language
-- Have experience writing and/or editing ecommerce copy (SEO experience a plus!)
-- Can follow instructions
-- Can positively accept and apply feedback
-- Can stick to deadlines
-- Will only submit unique content
-- Can and are willing to do research when required
-- Can accept payment via PayPal on a weekly basis

If you have the time and ability to help, please reach out ASAP. We have work available NOW and need immediate help. This is a freelance position, but we have plenty to keep you busy. Pay varies per project and role, but writing projects are in the range of 3 to 5 cents per word.

items.title: Digital Fundraising Strategist
items.content:
Digital Fundraising Strategist at Rainforest Action Network

Remote

ABOUT RAN
For 30 years, Rainforest Action Network (RAN) has campaigned for the forests, their inhabitants and the natural systems that sustain life. In coalition with Indigenous communities and allies from around the world, RAN uses non-violent direct action, grassroots organizing, education, and strategic communications to challenge corporations to stop destructive operations, respect human rights, and adopt comprehensive policies that reduce their contributions to global warming.

The Digital Fundraising Strategist position is responsible for overseeing the management and daily maintenance of RAN’s digital fundraising and marketing channels, including email appeals, digital advertising, peer to peer fundraising, social media platforms, and website donation forms and lightboxes. The role requires a strong understanding of digital communications, marketing, fundraising, project management and usability. The Digital Fundraising Strategist plays a crucial supporting role to the Digital Director and will need to have a balance between strong creative and strategic thinking, technical and data analytical skills, and the ability to communicate professionally and effectively.

Responsibilities:

  • Creates and implements strategies for digital fundraising, member engagement and online advocacy campaigns across digital platforms
  • Leads the project management, writing and execution of fundraising and cultivation email campaigns; manages Peer to Peer giving campaigns
  • Responsible for our digital advertising program including: budget management; drafting, building and testing digital ads; donation landing pages; Google Grants; and growing our email acquisition program
  • Plans, project manages, creates and executes all content for EOY giving and Giving Tuesday — including EOY digital ad copy, donation landing pages, data tracking, emails, Giving Tuesday, and tax reminder campaigns.
  • Analyzes monthly and year over year data reports on the progress of digital fundraising and list growth and makes strategic adaptations accordingly. Ensure that all digital outreach efforts are consistently tracked (tracking digital acquisition ads, digital fundraising ads, membership emails, organic donations, return on investment, etc.)
  • Grows and maintains our Digital monthly and annual sustainers via email, social media and ads
  • Implements and drives supporter cultivation, including Welcome series, Sunset series, cultivation and thank you emails, automated donation responses, and an annual supporter survey
  • Manages remote production contractor and advertising vendor
  • Monitors daily donations to troubleshoot potential tech issues
  • Collaborates with Digital Campaign Manager to ensure engaging and strong community on RAN’s Facebook and Instagram pages by following social media best practices; manages and implements digital fundraising across social media channels
  • Oversees the production of multimedia fundraising assets for the organization
  • Other duties as assigned by supervisor

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3-5 years’ experience with digital fundraising for advocacy or nonprofit sectors
  • Minimum 3-5 years of experience managing online advocacy databases such as Nation Builder, Engaging Networks, Blue State Digital, Action Kit, Salsa, Convio, etc.
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Strong data analysis experience
  • Experience using A/B testing in an advocacy, fundraising and/or marketing capacity
  • Advanced understanding of Facebook ads
  • Strong creative writing skills
  • Excellent cross channel communications
  • Social media strategy experience with an emphasis on Facebook
  • Detail-oriented and able to work both with a team and independently
  • Basic understanding of HTML
  • Basic understanding of Liquid
  • Strong commitment to and belief in the power of using online resources to help empower communities and activists to make change in the world
  • Commitment to Racial Justice
  • Graphic design and video editing a plus
  • Demonstrates an awareness and sensitivity to the needs and concerns of individuals from diverse cultures, backgrounds and orientations.
  • Contributes to the creation of a diverse, equitable and inclusive work culture that encourages and celebrates differences.

RACIAL JUSTICE

RAN strives to integrate values of equity and fairness into our work, which includes bringing an intentional racial justice analysis to our programmatic work and organizational structure. We are seeking candidates who have a commitment to engage in this ongoing process and work with us to create a just and inclusive work environment and world. RAN provides all people with equal employment and volunteer opportunities while also staying committed to providing accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. We encourage applicants of color to apply for this position.

COMPENSATION

The target salary range for this position is based off a competitive San Francisco Bay Area Non-profit location, which is between $66,500 and $70,000**. The final salary will be determined based on the candidate experience & overall qualifications.

**Note: Adjustments to the final salary will also be made depending on the candidate’s geographical location compared to the SF Bay Area. (Example: If hired in a location such as Austin, TX, the salary would be geographically adjusted lower depending on the cost of labor compared to San Francisco, CA)

Benefits include full health coverage for the employee and their partner/family (plus an employer funded HSA), VSP & dental insurance, 4 weeks PTO (increases to 5 weeks after 2 years), and a Simple IRA retirement plan with a 3% fully vesting employer match. Additionally, after 5 years, staff becomes eligible for a 3 month fully paid sabbatical.

Status: Full-time

Location: San Francisco/remote
