items.content:
We are looking for a psychology whiz with a passion for marketing to delve into the growing Duel team. You will play a key role in the creation of an entirely new marketing category - Customer Advocacy Marketing. Specifically, you will join Duel.Intelligence, our research and consultancy arm, where you will contribute to the development of our approach and research. You will then help capture the value created by this insight, using cutting edge digital marketing techniques to drive leads and ultimately sales.

You will work closely with the founders and will directly affect the success of the business. We will build a team around you as we grow. You will also contribute ideas and additions to the product.

*THE BUSINESS*

Duel.Tech, an enterprise-grade Brand Ambassador Management Platform, allows brands to collaborate with brand ambassadors to create amazing content, drive social posts, referral & affiliate purchases, and leave feedback, reviews & testimonials.

Based in London and Bristol, the business is backed by Venture Capital and set for substantial growth in 2019.

*THE ROLE*

*Create and optimise Duel’s inbound marketing strategy; exploring all avenues to generate qualified leads for the *Sales Team to enact upon
*Develop our content strategy; defining what content means for Duel
*Assist in the running of our Adwords and SEO initiatives
*Research into our brand partners’ pain points and possible solutions
*Use your psychology knowledge to contribute to Duel Intelligence - a team dedicated to consulting brands based on the theories behind why customers shop the way they do
*Develop captivating content and our online presence
*Run longer term, more strategic projects that will bring a step-change in organic reach for Duel
*Analyze the metrics and ensure resources are used effectively and efficiently
*Drive traffic to our site and further convert to demos
*Maximise limited budgets to create unlimited buzz
*Help to build and manage an inbound marketing team over time


*THE PERSON*

*Be an excellent writer, able to spot a compelling story and know exactly how to turn it into something our customers and the press want to talk about
*Completely process driven. You will A/B test your life and optimise ruthlessly
*Have a fine eye for what people care about and what genuinely useful content looks like
*Be hands-on, proactive and want to get things done quickly, but to a high standard
*Have ambitious ideas of what more we should be doing and you’re ready to take full ownership of content across owned and earned channels
*Have an interest in people and how they think / behave
*Be a creative thinker who brings contrarian, provocative and remarkable ideas to the table
*A background in psychology or a related field.
*You probably read a lot


*SKILL SET*

*Understanding of psychological theory and practice
*Experience in Marketing preferred but not essential
*Passion for learning
*Experience in ecommerce and/or retail preferred but not required
*Passion for the start-ups and the tech sector
*Great at absorbing, processing and organising information


*CULTURE*

*Flexible, relaxed and fun, but absolutely driven to making the business a success
*Tech and process driven – we make tech, we love tech and we use tech to make our lives easier where possible
*We work with people we like, and we like the people we work with. This means after work drinks, happy hours, boozy lunches and good-natured wind-ups
*We’re trying to build a remarkable company, with remarkable people and a remarkable culture that you will want to shout from the rooftops about

*WHAT WE OFFER*

*Open plan, cool loft office in between Borough and Southwark (dogs welcome) with a well stocked beer and gin fridge
*Flexible working hours and home working options (in fact, actively encouraged!)
*Unlimited / Zero holiday policy. If you don’t need to be in the office, do the work required from anywhere in the world - Skype is a wonderful thing.
*On-going training where required
*Perks: gym membership, Headspace subscription and work related or personal growth reading/Audible budget
*Options scheme for all full time employees – if you help us build the company, you should own some of it!
*Competitive salary
*Bonus package


To apply - please send us your CV and links of your work (blogs, press releases, campaign copy or any other written samples of your work) to the email specified.

(No recruiters, please! We would rather save the money and put it towards an awesome team day out. Also no phone calls. Everything must be done by email. Cheers!)

items.content:
About Us

We are the world´s largest language learning community with over 90m users from 190 countries, growing at up to 30,000 new users per day. We make learning a language easy by combining AI-powered courses with instant feedback from our global community of native speakers. Our mission is to break down language barriers across the globe.

Job Description

We’re looking for an ambitious Social Media Executive to join one of the fastest growing edtech companies in the world. This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing and dynamic team, with plenty of room to develop.

At busuu things move fast. If you want to work with smart, creative, energetic people and possess the initiative, confidence and good judgement to make independent decisions every day - then you are probably the perfect addition for our growing team.

What you will be doing

You will bring your creativity and passion for social media to help develop engaging content that helps promote our brand and engage our audience.

Generating new concepts and content ideas to constantly grow and engage our audiences.
Creating and scheduling engaging content across our key social media channels.
Working closely with our customer satisfaction team to manage our online communities of more than 2.2 million followers worldwide.
Managing and updating the company’s social media calendars.
Monitoring social media channels for brand mentions and issues.
Working alongside in-house and external localisation teams, designers and videographers to manage the delivery of assets.
Maintaining brand identity through consistent tone of voice, quality of posts across the channels.
Regularly measuring channel and post performance and deep-diving into analytics to make on-going improvements.
Providing general assistance to the wider marketing team & CMO as required for ad hoc projects and tasks.
What you will bring to the table

Graduate in Journalism, English, Marketing, Communications or other relevant field
Proven track record of results delivery and excellent project management skills
Experience with social media platforms and social media management tools
Attention to detail and accuracy
Strong analytical mindset and a good business sense
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Passion for language education and digital learning, with fluent English and at least one additional languages
Not ticking every box or think you’ve got that unique set of skills we haven’t realised we need? Get in touch anyway; we’re always looking to add great people at every level.

Why you should join busuu:

Manage your own stretch projects
Competitive salary and attractive bonus scheme
Private healthcare
Yearly training budget to use as you want
Free breakfast and snacks
Free dinner if you need to stay late
Regular company trips and evenings out in London
Smart, fun and international team to work with


A bit more about us:

busuu has received several awards such as ‘Europe’s Best Education Start-up’ by TechCrunch, ‘Best of iOS Apps’ by Apple and ‘Best of Google Play’ by Google to name a few and we are part of the prestigious Future Fifty Program consisting of UK’s best Scale-Ups. We collaborate with world-leading universities (CUNY, UCL etc.) in the field of language learning research, and partner with companies such as Google, Amazon and Facebook to bring language learning to AI-powered devices (Google Home, Amazon Alexa) and into virtual reality (Oculus).

busuu has raised over 15m EUR and is backed by renowned business angels and serial entrepreneurs (Johann Hansmann, Martin Varsavsky, Brent Hoberman), PROFounders Capital and McGraw-Hill Education.

We are an ambitious, high-energy, international and friendly team of 100+, based in central London. We come from diverse backgrounds and share a passion for tech start-ups and education.

At busuu, things move fast. If you’re enthusiastic, motivated and want to help us to enable hundreds of millions of people around the world to learn a language, get in touch. It’s your chance to change the world.

items.content:
About MyTutor
One-to-one tuition is proven to significantly improve pupils’ grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. MyTutor’s mission is to bring life-changing tuition to all. Our handpicked network of tutors work online with pupils from all walks of life, and we’ve given over a quarter of a million lessons so far – raising results on average by one whole grade. We’re proud of the fact that over 300 schools have also chosen to work with us. And that we’ve earned a Trustpilot rating of 9.4/10.
We understand the hectic lives of families with teenagers, and our flexible lesson times mean parents can juggle schedules more easily. On our website, it’s simple to find a tutor your child gets on with – and every lesson is tailored to their needs. Also, by having lessons via live video, pupils can access the best tutors no matter where they live or when they need help. No travelling for Mum and Dad, no waiting around, no strangers in your home. Pupils can have their lessons anywhere – at Grandma’s, at a friend’s house or on holiday, so there’s no disruption in the run-up to exams.
Tuition is now more affordable and accessible, making life less stressful for busy parents doing their best.

About The Role
You’ll be joining at an exciting time as our consumer business rapidly scales. We’re looking for a consumer product manager focussed on making it easy for parents and students to find great tutors that deliver results. You’ll be leading our consumer product strategy, working closely with design, technology and the wider consumer team and reporting into our Head of Product.

What will I be doing?
- Manage, understand and prioritise the consumer product roadmap, so the team is always working on the most impactful features
Regularly interact with our target audience, customers and our parent panel to clearly define and frame problems for the team to solve
- Evaluate and learn from your solutions using data analysis and user feedback in order to understand business impact
- Work closely with the wider MyTutor team ensuring stakeholders are involved and up to speed on proposed changes, through workshops, requirement gathering sessions and product demos
- Love all things product and always be working to deliver the best product innovations for our customers
- Be a great team player as you’ll be working with smart, driven people passionate about delivering great features for our customers.

What skills should you have?
- Previous experience in a Product Manager role
- Clear communicator of product decisions and the rationale behind them. Be comfortable in making decisions - - without consensus
- Experience working with qualitative customer insights, and quantitative customer data to help inform your decisions. Bonus if you’ve conducted user research.
- Good technical understanding in order to work with the development team to scope and prioritise work
Provide input into design decisions, helping create intuitive simple user experiences


Benefits
- Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people
- A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support
- Training and investment in your learning
- Your own laptop and hardware to use as you please
- Competitive salary and option package
- Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair
- Tuesday Breakfasts, Friday drinks and regular team events & outings
- 24 days holiday (plus public holidays)

MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with an EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

Vanquish Fitness is a rapidly growing fitness and lifestyle clothing brand, based in London.

The brand found its identity by releasing apparel inspired by high fashion trends as well as functional design. We believe that with our brand, team, and values, there is nothing that can stop us from being one of the most successful athleisurewear brands in the industry.

We want you to be another star player in our team to help us achieve this.

We’re focused on making an impact.

At Vanquish we encourage creativity, ownership, and solution-based thinking. The majority of the success we have had as a team in our 5-year history is from promoting a collaborative environment. This includes being open to making mistakes, positively challenging each other, and having the autonomy to create their best work.

You will be joining a passionate team who are making their mark in the fitness industry.

*The traits we are looking for are:*

*Analytical* - You have the opportunity to scale channels you manage indefinitely.
As a result, we expect you to take reasoned, measured data-based decisions.

*Self-starter* - We are growing. Fast. You will assist with new initiatives and solve problems and challenges that come our way. We want people who are comfortable to be left to find their feet.

*Hungry* - We crave those who are versatile, willing to learn and love new challenges. Most importantly, to be motivated to have a massive impact on both themselves and Vanquish Fitness.

*Dependable* - You will have autonomy (after training is complete) so strong performance is necessary. You will be open-minded and willing to take and give constructive feedback.

*Manage and launch PPC campaigns
*Manage email campaigns
*A/B test relentlessly
*Work alongside the creative/brand team
*Assist on cross-channel marketing initiatives
*Ultimately, your role would be to help rapidly scale Vanquish’s digital presence

*1+ years of managing PPC campaigns in a performance marketing role
*Resonates with the listed values
*Ready to take a hands-on approach to grow the business
*Loves to learn and willing to get out of their comfort zone

*Social media marketing experience (Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Snapchat, Twitter)
*Interested in high fashion, streetwear or fitnesswear
*Experience within a startup environment
*Entrepreneurial spirit

*Incredible responsibility in one of the fastest growing clothing companies in the UK.

items.title: Marketing Growth Analyst
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Hello, we’re Anorak. We’re busy building the world’s smartest independent insurance adviser - and we need an outstanding Marketing Growth Analyst to join our rapidly growing team based at our London offices to help us design, build and deliver our service.

We’re building a regulated advice platform to give everyone access to tailored life insurance advice. We’re backed by AXA group funded, Kamet – a fast insurtech start-up studio backing entrepreneurs who build groundbreaking technology companies.

Our people are what make us awesome; Our team is made up of data scientists, tech geeks, design heavyweights and insurance experts from all over the world.

Alongside our Head of product, you will be responsible for understanding the end-to-end customer funnel in order to optimise opportunities and help users realise the full potential of our life insurance advice platform. You will work in collaboration with different teams including Engineering, Design and Product.

You will deeply understand and measure the effectiveness of Anorak platform by defining and monitoring operational metrics for the team, run review cadences within them and collaborate with different stakeholders to understand our user needs and product capabilities.

Requirements

Establish Anorak’s growth framework

* Work with the product, design and engineering teams to define & own the growth delivery framework
* Utilise qualitative and quantitative insights to develop hypotheses & drive A/B testing
* Define metrics and KPIs to measure the effectiveness of experiments
* Take a customer-centric approach to growth to uncover insights and drive action
* Work with designers and developers to create a coherent and agile testing approach
* Develop, own and present product’s performance reporting suite
* Communicate and foster alignment for the growth strategy across the company.
* Implement ‘non technical’ optimisation initiatives, including planning, idea management, testing, optimisation, reporting, and forecasting; this includes: defining test criteria and method, metrics, creating and executing tests (using Optimizely, or similar tools)

Deliver conversion improvement on the platform

* Own and execute experiments plan to improve funnel metrics
* Identify poorly performing features and workflows, and work towards improving them.
* Improve platform metrics at each stage of the user flow starting with entry point into the funnel (landing pages, campaigns, SEO, etc.)
* Develop, implement and test email automation and cross channel CRM
* Report performance

Who you are

* You have 5+ years of experience in a product/marketing growth role, with a proven track record ideally in a scale-up business
* You have prior experience with using and implementing marketing automation tools
* You have run hundreds of tests and have a clear perspective on what does and doesn’t work
* You have a sharp product sense that allows you to determine what will work for users, what will most effectively move the metric, and what will be too complex to build & test
* You have experience working with analytics tools and using them to drive improved online performance incl. Mixpanel / Google Analytics / Google Tag Manager / A/B testing tools such as Google Optimise or Optimizely
* You are well organised with great attention to detail.
* You are a “do-er”, willing to work hands-on including stepping in to work directly with the development team
* You are an excellent communicator in English, whether it be in words or in writing.

Benefits

Why join Anorak?

There are a whole bunch of factors that make Anorak a great place to work; not least that we’re on the cutting edge of technological change, working at the intersection of business, digital technology and creativity.

Here’s just a few more reasons why Anorak could be the place for you:

* You’ll work in this booming as part of a future global leader.
* You’ll work with an international network of experts
* You’ll benefit from a stimulating working environment with creative projects
* You will benefit from AXA’s expertise and operational support
* You will enjoy a steep learning curve

Additionally we offer:

* 25 days holidays
* Private Medical insurance (Vitality)
* Pension contribution - 5% employee / 4% employer
* Death in Service (life insurance)

items.title: User Researcher
items.content:
The property industry is broken and we’re fixing it. The Housing Crisis is an issue which has an effect on all of us. We’re helping to make a systemic change in the property industry, using our software to make the sector more dynamic, transparent, and efficient.

*About the company*
LandInsight is a new platform that is fundamentally changing how the property industry buys land for development. It’s a big data platform that speeds up the process of finding, assessing and buying land. It comes at an important time, one of the biggest challenges for the UK housing crisis is tackling the shortage of development land. Our tech has changed the game and as a result we’ve become the UK’s fastest growing PropTech company (and we’ve got the awards to prove it!).

People are taking notice too - our user base is doubling regularly and already, tens of thousands of homes have been built on sites that were sourced using LandInsight, and that’s just the beginning.

To support and accelerate this growth we’re looking for ambitious, creative and collaborative people to join the LandInsight family.

*Our culture*
Our values are ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’ and we regularly hold ourselves accountable to these. The people who work here feel that they are challenged, but also feel like they have the environment and tools to succeed.

We truly believe that businesses flourish when people work collaboratively. That’s why we prioritise team building and facilitation. We are in constant contact with the company founders, so are able to learn about the conception of and running of a tech startup that is scaling. We run weekly sessions to ensure every voice is heard and empowered to grow and contribute.

We don’t just make empty gestures about our culture - we were voted as the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work at, and have also received awards for ‘Diversity Advocate’ and ‘Best at Employee Development’.


*Your mission *
As LandInsight’s first User Researcher your mission is to build a deep understanding of our customers and prospects. You’ll be in charge of driving both qualitative user research and quantitative product insights, interpreting the data to provide compelling insights.
By understanding our users, the problems they face, and how they use our product, you’ll play a key role in both our product development and the future strategy, helping us deliver the best site finding experience possible.

*Responsibilities*
*You will provide user insights to our cross-functional product teams, working alongside our Product Managers, Engineers and Designer to generate hypotheses and plan and run research to help us deliver better solutions to the problems we are solving for our customers
*You will ensure we are tracking the right product metrics and translating those findings into compelling recommendations
*You will champion data driven decision making, and will ensure company wide visibility of the insights you develop
*You will develop research programmes to help inform the strategic direction of the business, including both existing and future products
*You will provide leadership in research technique and methodology

*Essential criteria*
*Experience applying a range of user research methodologies.
*Able to choose the appropriate approach for different situations, balancing the desire for robust research methodology with business demands
*Experience turning research data into clear insights that inform decision-making
*Experience tracking and analysing SaaS product metrics in analytics platforms such as MixPanel
*A demonstrable track record of your user insights delivering tangible product benefits
*You are results-orientated, a self-starter, with the ability to juggle several projects at once
*Excellent communication skills

*Desirable criteria*
*Experience of B2B SaaS software
*Experience in PropTech

*Why work for us?*
*Flexible working hours
*Professional and personal training budget
*Competitive salary and equity options
*25 days paid holiday (additional to bank holidays)
*Unlimited unpaid holidays
*Dog friendly office
*Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day, an annual ski trip and monthly socials
*Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
*Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a beer/glass of prosecco with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

items.content:
*We’re looking for a world-class paid search marketer to help millions of people discover an easier way to get great clothes and feel confident about the way they dress.*

Thread is an ambitious, well-funded fashion technology startup based in London that's looking to reinvent retail.

We’re part of a new generation of retailers, helping customers overwhelmed by near-infinite choice to get the clothes that are perfect for them. We combine human stylists and powerful machine learning algorithms to create amazing recommendations, and have developed a full e-commerce platform for an end-to-end shopping experience. Our ambition is to become the clothes button on your phone (Thread = clothes, Spotify = music, Uber = taxi), changing how millions of people across the world buy their clothes.

Paid search is a new channel for Thread (unusual for a retailer, we know), and this is an opportunity to shape a core growth channel for one of London’s most exciting startups. So, we’re looking for a smart, versatile, results-driven digital marketer to join Thread and help us find new customers who will love our service. You’ll work as part of a world class marketing team, with talent from Made.com, Spotify, Wieden + Kennedy and beyond.

You’ll be based in our brand new Aldgate office, which has lots of natural light, plants, a relaxed Studio area for coworking with music, and an outdoor terrace for barbecues and working outside when it’s sunny.

*Key Responsibilities*
* Own forecasting, delivery and reporting of Paid Search. Channels Managers at Thread are autonomous, with the freedom to set whatever strategy and tactics best deliver on goals
* Build and deliver the Paid Search testing roadmap. You’ll be responsible for identifying our highest value search opportunities, prioritising them into a roadmap, and rallying the resources to deliver the tests
* Be a world class expert in the channel. Thread Channel Managers combine a deep technical knowledge of their channels and relationships with partners to get access to new tools and insights, and a constant desire to stay ahead of the market
* Develop Thread’s paid search strategy. As we launch new markets, consider new brands we want to partner with and shape our overall strategy, you’ll be responsible for helping us to understand Paid Search, and ensure we’re set up for success

*Are you the one? You are if you have:*
* A few years experience of managing paid search, preferably with experience working on large product catalogues, including experience on Google Shopping and non-brand PPC
* Exceptional analytical skills, with an ability to deliver clear reporting, accurate forecasts, and actionable insights. SQLs skills strongly preferred
* Strong communication skills; you’re able to communicate the big picture and intricacies of Paid Search to the rest of the team
* Experience managing relationships with stakeholders at Google to access new products and expertise
* A love for analytics and optimisation. You are comfortable and happiest digging through mounds of data to find insights and drive results
* A broad interest and passion for marketing. You know things never stay the same, so you’re always learning about what’s next and what’s driving that change

*Benefits*
* The chance to break new ground and develop cutting-edge techniques for acquiring new customers online
* The opportunity to become recognised as one of the best in your field by being a core operator for a high-profile startup
* The chance to solve hard problems in a fast growing business, providing an unrivalled opportunity to develop your skill set
* Be part of a collaborative, values-led team that are working hard to create one of the highest quality cultures in the world. Learn more about how we’re doing this in our culture deck
* Relaxed, sociable work environment with lots of responsibility and autonomy
* Free team lunches four times a week, as well as fruit and snacks. We also have drinks and snacks together as a company on Fridays, as well as regular company trips to fun things like comedy shows, axe throwing, quizzes, bowling and weekly yoga classes
* Choose your own work equipment. It’s important to us that you’re set up for success in your role and comfortable in your setting
* Working-from-home opportunities and flexible working hours, to help you develop a healthy work-life balance
* Unlimited vacation time so you can recharge and relax
* Equal parental leave. We offer 4 months fully paid leave for both mothers and fathers following the birth or adoption of their child
* A competitive salary and a generous equity stake in the company (you're working hard to make the company successful, so we believe you should share generously in the reward!)

We’re Farewill - we build simple, beautiful products to change the way the world deals with death.

We’ve grown quickly to lead our industry, becoming the biggest (and favourite) will-writer in the UK in just 3 years. We launched our probate service in March 2019, helping families at the difficult, emotional time of a bereavement.

We’re a growing, tight-knit, multidisciplinary team of 25+ genuinely nice people. We're at the forefront of legal technology, playing a crucial role in modernising important legal services. In January 2019 we received £8m in Series A funding.

*The opportunity for a user researcher:*

You’ll be working on the fascinating, difficult problem of death. Our customers are facing difficult choices that impact the rest of their lives: they may be planning for the future; they may be dying; they may have lost a loved one. It’s a challenging subject and a challenging market. What we do has a big impact on real people.

We have a strong research and design culture, from the ground up and top down. Our design team are generalists with a strong focus on research, and our developers are user-focused. We work collaboratively on problems and user needs. But... we have no dedicated user researcher! You’ll be the first. This is an amazing opportunity for you to define the discipline of user research at Farewill and cement a strong research-and-user-centric ideology. Make it your own. In time we hope you’ll have the opportunity to lead other researchers, if you aspire to leadership.

*About you:*

You’re empathetic. You’re an experienced user researcher. You’re a generalist: you apply the right method to the question at hand. Your first love is qualitative research but you have a solid grounding in quant. You have plenty of hands on experience of research in its many forms, but for you it’s never just about outputs: it’s about bringing people along on the journey, furthering a shared business mission and - most of all - working in teams to build brilliant, user-centric products.

*In the next 12 months, you’ll:*

* Work embedded in our wills and probate teams, collaborating closely with product managers, designers, developers and others to build products that solve problems and meet user needs
* Improve existing products and help launch new ones
* Build the research function at Farewill from scratch, in collaboration with and support from Tom Hiskey, Victor Hwang and others in the design and tech teams
* Gain a deep understanding of our products, users and business goals: you’ll be the main voice of the user in the business
* Plan, run and analyse qualitative studies, including interviews, remote and in-person usability tests, and contextual and ethnographic research (yes you’ll be running usability tests, but this role is much more than just testing)
* Document and curate research, building a central knowledge resource for future projects
* Communicate findings not only within the product teams but also with the wider business, to help bring others along on the journey

*Ideally you'll have some or all of the following:*

* Empathy, listening and ability to speak with customers at a difficult time
* Experience leading the research effort within a product team
* Working collaboratively with designers, developers and others to build fantastic products
* Experience organising and running research studies and recruiting participants
* Experience with a variety of qualitative methods, such as remote and in-person usability testing, interviews, diary studies, ethnographic research and card-sorting
* A grounding in quantitative research including surveys and data analysis
* Self-organised and able to handle multiple projects and priorities
* A brilliant communicator: you bring research to life, bringing practical ideas to teams to help build user-focused solutions
* Ability to bring the team along on the journey and buy into the value of research
* Pragmatism: you apply the right amount of research for a given context and problem

*Bonus points for:*
* Experience working with bereaved or vulnerable users
* Being scrappy and working on a few things at once (we’re a startup!)
* Working with other insight-driven people including data analysts and quant researchers
Complementary interests or experiences beyond research (for example, many of our developers have design backgrounds)

BENEFITS
Competitive salary and share options
Santander cycles membership
Regular off-site days and team lunches
Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day
28 days holiday + bank holidays

items.content:
About movemeon

We’re a fast growing, tech-enabled, central London based growth business. We were founded with the simple aim to make discovering great jobs easier.

Today Movemeon is used by 35,000+ members, 2,500+ businesses (from the likes of Uber and Apple to early stage VC-backed startups) and in 100+ countries. ~200 candidates and ~15 businesses join the membership every week. We deliver them unique opportunities, insight and events through an exclusive members network.

We are also planning to expand fast into new geographies and new professional niches as well as exploring exciting new products like payspective.com. It’s all go!

We can take you through our vision when we meet you. Suffice to say, we are thinking big and need your help to execute.


The team

The two founders, Nick Patterson and Richard Rosser set-up movemeon after their frustration with recruitment agencies. We are now a team of 16 and are highly international (French, Italian, Portuguese, German). We’re continuing to expand and expect a steady flow of new joiners this year. Our office is near Vauxhall (central London) in a complex also home to other growth businesses.

About the Product manager role

We are looking for someone to take our product to the next level. It’s an opportunity to be hands-on and take as much responsibility as you can handle, managing our developers and participating in the creation of the product vision/ roadmap from day one.

Your key responsibilities will include:
• Understanding our users: speak to our customers and understand what they like, and what frustrates them. Use this intelligence, plus feedback collated from the team, to understand what we need to build as a priority.
• Managing the product roadmap: You’ll be working with our head of product to understand how the product can be optimized for each function (in addition to the user priorities). You’ll participate in the creation of the product roadmap, prioritizing the ongoing delivery of highest impact changes. You will also communicate progress against this roadmap to the broader team: putting you at the centre of the business
• Owning our email: You’ll be the owner of all the automatic emails that come from our site and will be in charge of their optimisation
• Running the sprint process: You’ll help the teams to develop great technical and design specifications for the developers to work towards. You’ll then lead a team of two back-end developers (offshore) to deliver against these specifications. You will have responsibility for improving the process/ managing the contract with the developers to ensure they are delivering to our standards
• Identifying high-impact UX changes: we want you to be consistently updating the look and feel of the site. You will be expected to regularly use the site as a “user” and see what frustrates you
• Measure and iterate: Measure the impact of the changes we make, and use the results to inform further product changes. We measure the impact of pretty much everything we do. So you’ll get to see (and analyse) plenty of interesting data that will show just how much your hard work is contributing to the growth of the business.

What the right candidate will bring to the table

We’re looking for someone with coding experience (PHP and HTML) or a degree in computer science. Strong problem solving and logic, as well as analytics, are great for any product role.

Specifically we’re looking for:
• Knowledge of PHP and HTML/ degree in computer science
• Evidence that you are a 'do-er' (yes, thinking is important but lots of stuff needs to get done). You’ll be proactive and demonstrate that you get stuck in, organize things and have probably always had holiday jobs / part time work etc.
• Super organized – we are growing fast which means things change regularly and can be chaotically busy. You’ll need to keep a clear head and religiously get through your to do list.
• Entrepreneurship in your DNA – you never fancied / tried but got frustrated with a corporate job.
• Desire to take on responsibility quickly. As MMO grows, we’ll want you to grow with us. So that means quickly stepping up to manage more aspects of the business and potentially more people too.
• Minimum of a 2:1 degree from a UK Russell Group (or international equivalent) university
• Fluent written and spoken English
• Fun team member (we have lots of it)


So if this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you (see details below).

About our offer:

• Exciting business in a time of rapid growth
• Start-up environment and ethos (i.e. we don’t do face time and we don’t do anything that doesn’t need to be done)
• Respect for and encouragement of your own ideas and initiatives
• Real responsibility
• Fun, smart team of normal people
• A sensible work life balance (we leave the office by 6pm every day and don’t work weekends)
• Monthly team fun & annual away weeks (like last year’s trips to Montenegro and Barcelona)
• An office in central SW London (we’re based near Vauxhall tube)
• 25 days holiday + 2 extra days at Christmas
• Competitive salary & quarterly bonus related to metrics you can track and control

At Chattermill we use cutting-edge AI technology to give leading companies the key to improving their customer experience. We work with many of the most exciting companies in the world (Uber, HelloFresh, Spotify, Transferwise, Skyscanner, and Deliveroo to name a few!) and are passionate about helping them put their customers’ at the heart of their decision making.

In three short years, we’ve grown from two co-founders to a team of 40 (and counting) bright and diverse individuals. We have big plans and are now looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join us to amplify our product marketing strategy as we develop the Chattermill platform. The Product Marketing Manager will undertake key industry and customer research to refine our customer personas and enhance our sales enablement collateral, processes and approach.

*As a Product Marketing Manager, you will:*

* Take care of the creative development and publication of a range of product related marketing collateral including blog posts, case studies, webinars, and thought leadership pieces to convey Chattermill’s capabilities to partners and prospective clients
* Develop sales collateral and product marketing materials that set us apart from our competitors and showcase our product capabilities
* Support sales efforts by developing enabling collateral for all stages of the sales cycle including white-papers, slide decks, and videos
* Work to position Chattermill as a Category Leader in the Customer Experience space
* Take ownership of marketing activities around the launch of upcoming products and release of our upgraded platform
* Collaborate with product management and strategy leaders to develop a launch model and ensure launches are integrated with campaigns
* Partner with product development and engineering teams through the complete product development cycle to help create our communication strategies for our platform to ensure an audience-centric approach across the product portfolio
* Conduct research to gather insight around target personas including their buyer needs and the purchasing decision process
* Partner with Sales and Customer Success to establish strategies to drive customer retention, up-sell and cross sell the product portfolio

*What we’re looking for:*

* Prior experience in B2B marketing, product marketing, marketing communications or sales enablement marketing
* Experience in implementing marketing strategies and campaigns that provide product insight to customers
* A track record of producing impactful sales enablement materials and marketing collateral
* Excellent project management skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and campaigns
* A collaborative individual who thrives when working with cross functional teams
* A strong understanding of content strategy and copy production across product marketing and sales enablement
* High emotional intelligence and the ability to think like each of our customers
* A lateral thinker who takes an indirect and creative approach to problem solving
* You’re excited at the prospect of coming up with creative approaches to Marketing that we may not have done before
* A strong customer focus and the ability to identify different customer and market segments, various buyer personas, and develop initiatives that address these specifically
* Strong commercial awareness and the desire to help grow the business

*Nice to have:*

* Prior experience working with SaaS products
* A good understanding of Customer Experience and passion for helping our clients in this area
* Degree level education in Marketing or similar
* Design skills and experience using Sketch or Illustrator
* Experience with customer research and user segmentation
* Prior experience in Product launch and market positioning

*Why join us?*

* A competitive salary and stock options
* Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us!
* 25 days holiday (in addition to bank holidays)
* Company pension plan matched at 3%
* A big focus on personal development including a £500 development budget and biweekly Breakfast and Learns
* Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, gym memberships and more
* Flexible working conditions and the opportunity to work from home
* Lovely office (with great coffee, events, and a rooftop terrace)
* Office wellness events like Monday Mindfulness and yoga
* Quarterly Company Socials planned by our great colleagues!

items.title: Co-Founder for fast-growing influencer marketing company
items.content:
We’re looking for a growth marketing and technology focused Co-Founder to join INKWAVE and help disrupt the influencer marketing industry.
____

Who we are:

Influencer marketing is the fastest growing marketing channel, with projected growth going from £1.7B in 2017 to over £10B by 2020.

At INKWAVE, we create and amplify meaningful conversations with influence. Currently the influencer marketing industry has become cluttered with abrasive content strategies and unnatural relationships through platforms. We are unique in our approach because we care about building a sustainable future for the influencer marketing industry by matching the brand’s values with the influencer’s values to have more authentic collaborations.
We are unique in our approach because we combine creativity and technology to develop highly impactful and transformative influencer strategies.

In under six months we have already worked with leading brands in the US and Europe such as Mastercard and start-ups such as Curated Crowd and Fin.
____

Where we are with the company:
We’ve been revenue generating since the first day of launch in July last year.
We’re now preparing to raise seed capital to accelerate our growth, develop the product & grow the team.

At this stage, we’re looking for someone who is open and agile in their approach compared to the more traditional job functions.

The key focus will be on powering growth marketing efforts and supporting with the development of the new tech solution.

It’s a hands-on role and you will need to be able to help develop and implement a sales strategy and support with the future vision of the business.

You would join the current full-time founder and a small team of part-time/freelancers working out of co-working space/remotely.
____

We’re looking for applicants who:
• Have experience in marketing and technology, bonus if you’re in the influencer industry already
• Have startup experience (whether an ex-founder or having worked in an early stage startup)
• Driven and independent with a growth mindset
• Passionate about entrepreneurship and the influencer marketing industry
• Look to implement cutting edge technologies
• Support in implementing a development roadmap
• A confident communicator who can sell an idea/solution

__

What We Offer
• The opportunity to become the cofounder of a fast growing startup
• A generous equity package (experience based)
• Salary after the seed raise, and some pay to cover some living expenses until then
• Flexible working (you can work on a flexible schedule & you can work remotely and out of our coworking space)

items.title: Senior Marketer Required
items.content:
Fossu Ltd is a niche company which specialises in creating high-growth start-ups. We are currently looking to hire a freelance marketer, before transitioning them to an employed position, to help manage the marketing activities of our current retainer clients.

Who are we?
We're a boutique company focused on the creation of big ideas that we're passionate about. Sometimes they're our clients, sometimes they're our own. We bring ideas to life and we help them grow.

What do we do?
1. We invest our time and energy into helping our clients with their big ideas. We build their tech, find funding, and help them with their marketing.
2. We build our own ideas. We build our own businesses that we're passionate about, ideas we feel the world needs.

Who do we serve?
We serve our clients (the founders), our partners, our investors and our community. We build an ecosystem in which allows business ideas to flourish. Good business benefits everyone, and that’s what we try to achieve.

Our Mission
Facilitate entrepreneurs, founders and our own staff to build big ideas that we're passionate about.

The Job Role
We are looking for a self-starter, someone who has previous experience working in or with start-ups and a bit of an all-round marketer. The role includes a lot of account management and client responsibilities as you will be the main person overseeing the clients account.

The job role will begin in a freelance format, with the review to becoming an employed position in the first 6 months. Due to the nature of start-ups, the role will begin as being revenue share based. The founder is currently managing marketing retainer work of around £6000 p/m, any successful hire will receive a 50% revenue share of any client account work they take on under the company. We would expect your earnings to grow to around £3000- £4000 p/m. There will be an opportunity to grow with the company and eventually have a team underneath you.

The day to day responsibilities will be as follows:
- Creating marketing strategies and marketing proposals
- Providing updates and timelines to any clients
- Managing social media accounts
- Advising on existing marketing strategy in a CMO capacity
- Creating websites
- Managing other freelancers (e.g. Graphic designers, animators)
- Copywriting
- Creating social ads and doing marketing campaigns
- Analysing data and providing feedback on clients

Your skills should include:
- MS Skills (essential)
- Basic copywriting (essential)
- Familiarisation with a range of social platforms (Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, YouTube etc) (essential)
- Ability to create and run social ads across the above platforms (essential)
- Ability to build websites in website builders e.g. Squarespace, Web flow, Wix (essential)
- Ability to build websites with custom themes Winwordpress (desirable)
- Google analytics skills (desirable)
- SEO knowledge (desirable)
- Graphic design knowledge (desirable)

Working with start-ups, and overseeing their marketing is a tall task. We often have little budget and little room for error so any candidate must be highly adaptable and able to provide results quickly.

This position is remote. With weekly meet-ups wherever you are based and a view to creating an office in an agreed location closer to the time.

Fossu Ltd (previously Start-Up Partner Up www.startuppartnerup.co.uk) is going through a transitional time and fulfilling this position will allow us to scale and take on more startups. We are looking for a candidate who is ready for the excitement and rollercoaster that comes with working in a start-up that also works on start-ups.

(You will be responsible for your own tax and national insurance, paid holidays can be discussed in interview)

Product Manager 

SOCi

About Us:


SOCi is an award-winning social media and reputation management platform for multi-location brands and SMB agencies. We are growing fast - coming close to 100 people now, we were ranked 60th in the Inc5000 list of fastest-growing private companies in the United States in 2018 and 3rd in San Diego. We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to help us manage and expand our growing product portfolio. As a new Product Manager in SOCi, you would be paired with an Engineering Director and up to 9 engineers that you would work closely to continue to refine and build out sections of our SaaS platform, either around our presence (content management), care (reputation and engagements) or growth (ads) product lines.


*OPEN TO REMOTE CANDIDATES IN NORTH AMERICA*


Responsibilities and Requirements



* Maintain an ordered list of backlog based on priority for bugs, issues, and features (backlog grooming)

* Develop user stories and functional specifications for top items in the backlog (spec'ing)

* Work with Engineering Director and Technical Leads to refine technical specifications for new features and products

* Continually clarify product requirements and work closely with engineering teams on a daily basis

* Review and sign off on all product changes after they have been developed to ensure they match original requirements

* Solicit product feedback from internal (sales, CS, executive) and external (customers) stakeholders to expand product backlog

* Evaluate and report on product usage metrics on a regular basis to validate prior decisions and inform backlog grooming activities

* Ensure new products are complete and user-friendly such that they are easy to grasp and use

* Ensure adequate documentation and communication exists for product changes (in-app tutorials, product emails, knowledge base articles)

* 2+ years experience working in Product Management 

* Start up experience desired

* UX/ Frame working knowledge desired





What's SOCi's culture like?


Our primary driver is professional growth and learning, coupled with a desire to help our customer succeed. We have tons of books lying around the office, we focus heavily on individual mentorship and guidance, peer feedback and are always pushing ourselves and each other to the next level. We're huge on collaboration - mobing/swarming to solve problems either as individual engineering teams, or even Product/Engineering/Design leaders mobing to work out the best new product approach. We focus on moving fast, learning fast, and not looking back.


SOCi is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Director of Marketing (100% Remote)

Full-time
Anywhere
Remote job
Small business
Posted May 16 – Accepting applications
About Us

At Close, we’re building the sales communication platform of the future. With our roots as the very first sales CRM to include built-in calling, we’re leading the industry toward eliminating manual processes and helping companies to close more deals (faster). Since our founding in 2013, we’ve grown to become a fully profitable, 100% globally distributed team of 33 high-performing, happy people that are dedicated to building a product our customers love.
 
Our CEO, Steli Efti, made this video to highlight what we’re looking for in our Director of Marketing.
 
About You
You’re an experienced marketer that’s now mid-to-senior level in your career with at least two years of experience as a Head/Director/VP for a marketing team with more than five direct reports. You have a well-developed management philosophy and experience as a successful team leader that can demonstrate both company and employee growth.
 
You have over five years of experience in B2B SaaS/startup marketing. You have a proven track record leading the marketing team of a SaaS business in a similar industry with a strong background in demand generation.
 
You’re capable of spearheading everything from determining overall strategy, to hiring, recruiting, on-boarding new team members, establishing processes and driving our marketing results to the next level.   
 
You reside in North America or overlap with Eastern Time Zone for at least 4 hours a day. Bonus points if you’re technical, strong in content and have good brand instincts (we just acquired close.com and have big plans for our positioning in the industry).
 
About The Role
* Growing our team remotely and internationally
* Expanding our brand
* Expanding our marketing campaigns internationally (top 5 markets)
* Expanding our marketing efforts (social / paid / SEO / etc)
* Setting strategy and executing marketing campaigns
* Setting up an reporting KPIs
* Working closely with product and sales team to align all teams for growth
* Managing and leading current 4 person marketing team
 
Why Work With Us?
* 100% Remote (we believe in trust and autonomy)
* 2 x Annual Team Retreats ✈️ (Lisbon Retreat Video)
* Competitive salary
* Medical, Dental with HSA option - 99% premiums paid (US residents)
* 5 Weeks PTO + 6 Government Holidays + Dec 24 - Jan 1 Company Holiday
* Parental Leave (10 wks primary caregiver / 4 wks secondary caregiver)
* 401k matching at 4% (US residents)
* Our story and team 
* Glassdoor Reviews 
 
At Close, everyone has a voice. We encourage transparency and practicing a mature approach to the work-place. In general, we don’t have strict policies, we have guidelines. Work/Life harmony is an important part of our organization - we believe you bring your best to work when you practice self care (whatever that looks like for you).
 
We come from 12 countries and 14 states; a collection of talented humans rich in diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and cultures. Twice a year we meet up somewhere around the world to spend time with one another. We see these retreats as an opportunity to strengthen the social fiber of our community.
 
This team is growing in more ways than one - we’ve recently launched 8 babies (and counting!). Unanimously, our favorite and most impactful value is “Build a house you want to live in.” We strive to make decisions that are authentic for our organization. At Close, we have a high care factor for one another, in making an awesome product and championing the success of our customers.  
 
Interested in Close but don’t think this role is the best fit for you? View our other positions.

Job description

User Experience (UX) Research Lead

Location: Flexible, within the United States (Boston, MA or Eastern Time Zone preferred)

Position is available: Immediately

THE OPPORTUNITY

As User Experience (UX) Research Lead, you will work collaboratively with Product Managers, Engineers, and stakeholders across ANet’s National and Regional teams to craft an exceptional end user experience that maximizes the impact of our technology in service to educators and students. This is both a strategic and tactical role with the opportunity to partner with leaders across ANet to identify research needs and influence product and design decisions. This role reports to the Vice President of Product.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Establish ANet’s product research and UX practice in pursuit of maximizing the impact, effectiveness, and ease of use of our educator and student-facing tools
  • Guide product research throughout the product life-cycle from early stage generative research, through iterative UI testing and post-launch measurement
  • Deliver actionable and relevant product research insights (via user interviews, usability studies, focus groups, surveys, etc.) aligned to both strategic and tactical product and designs decisions
  • Manage the information architecture, user interface, and interaction flow of our educator and student-facing products
  • Create low and high-fidelity wireframes and mockups to facilitate product discovery research and development
  • In partnership with Product Managers, develop user personae, customer journey maps, conceptual diagrams, wireframes, and prototypes in support of our product roadmap
  • Build strong empathy and advocate passionately for our end users, ensuring that the product experience is aligned to user needs and expectations
  • Continually iterate and evolve the way we design for and learn from our customers

WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU BRING

In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following:

  • You have a passionate commitment to and a sense of urgency for the support of schools, along with a belief that all students can achieve at high levels
  • You are motivated by working in an environment where we live out our core values daily. You are eager to examine personal archetypes and biases while discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege which relate to ANet’s Advance Equity and People Matter values, and our work towards becoming an anti-racist organization
  • You’ve got about 5 years of hands-on experience and a track record of success with user experience design, information architecture, and product research for digital products
  • You know how to champion a UX research function and act as a customer advocate; you’ve translated research into actionable insights and recommendations that have had a significant impact on the customer experience
  • You have exceptional project management skills and are able to effectively manage multiple complex projects with competing deadlines while working cross-team and synthesizing feedback and input from product management, engineering, and marketing functions
  • You know how to weave key insights into a compelling narrative; your presentation and persuasion skills have led to success in building buy-in from leaders - whether in a formal presentation or via ad-hoc discussions - for bold ideas
  • You have expertise creating prototypes at various levels of fidelity to articulate and test user flows using modern tools (e.g., InVision, Keynote, etc), interaction and visual design documents, user stories, conceptual models, annotated wireframes, storyboards, creative briefs—and more
  • You can demonstrate fluency in best practices for web-based and mobile information architecture and responsive design, as well as deep and broad knowledge of usability principles and techniques
  • You’re always willing to roll up your sleeves and do what is necessary to meet team goals and effectively deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • You have a strong portfolio of UX/UI design work demonstrating your experience working on digital projects from concept to launch

 Ideal candidates may also demonstrate the following preferred qualifications:

  • You bring prior experience in K-12 education or Ed Tech
  • You have studied UX research, digital design, graphic design, and/or human-computer interaction
  • You have working knowledge of human-centered design principles (e.g. Design Thinking) and agile/lean software development
  • You have a proven ability in a variety of design tools such as InDesign, Sketch, Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, and prototyping tools (Invision, Axure, Framer, etc.)

WHAT WE OFFER

ANet offers highly competitive compensation based on prior experience and qualifications as well as comprehensive benefits in order to best support our people. Benefits we offer include: health, dental and vision insurance where ANet pays 80% of the cost of these benefits for employees and their families/domestic partner; 3 weeks of vacation (4 weeks after two years with ANet); 10 paid holidays with paid days off between the Christmas and New Year’s holidays; a paid floating holiday; paid sick & personal days; paid parental leave; retirement plan options; commuter benefits; tuition reimbursement;  flexible spending accounts; short and long-term disability coverage; and basic life and personal accident insurance.

HOW TO APPLY

We are now accepting applications for this position, which will be reviewed on a rolling basis.  To apply, please click on the “Apply” button.  You will then be prompted to complete a brief application and upload a resume and thoughtful cover letter in which you outline why you are interested in working for ANet and how your skills and experience meet the qualifications of the position.

ANet is committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds and gender identities to apply to our positions.

Apply now

About Achievement Network

WHO WE ARE

Every student deserves opportunities in life, and every educator committed to providing those opportunities, deserves support. Those beliefs drive us to work alongside schools to support great teaching so that we can work towards guaranteeing that all students are receiving high quality instruction. We partner with over 900 schools - both district and charter - in underserved communities around the country, thus impacting more than 330,000 students. Third-party evaluations confirm that when schools have the right basic conditions in place and partner with ANet, they achieve 6-8 months of additional learning over a two-year period compared to schools not partnering with ANet.

At ANet we are committed to living out our core values, both across our organization and with our partner schools. We acknowledge that systemic inequities impact student access to opportunities and that in order to ensure educational equity for all students, we must center on the experiences of those from marginalized communities to guide our work. We work to deepen our understanding of how race, class, power and privilege influence the education system as well as influence our own perspectives. To do so,  we provide ongoing learning opportunities through org-wide professional development, affinity groups, working groups, and resource sharing.

Dev Care Experience @Heetch

The top priority of our developer-driven team is to improve the productivity of other developers in the company by spotting generic needs across teams and addressing them in the most impactful way. Whether this is done by introducing a new technology or designing a creative solution to a problem shared by various teams, it's done through carefully collected feedbacks, analysis and is delivered iteratively, following closely open-source methodologies.

You can read more about our team on our blog.

From the inside, we're a caring team of engineers who share the same set of values:

  • Transparency: We discuss everything openly.
  • Team Unity: No one is left behind.
  • Move Fast: No need to demonstrate for days, do it.
  • Promulgate Knowledge: Whether it's organizational, cultural or technical, we're eager to learn!
  • It's OK to fail: Succeed together, learn together.

What will be your role?

By joining the team, you'll be in charge of shaping the foundations of our codebase by driving product development that delights our engineers. Ultimately you will enable developers to write robust code by targeting the most impactful generic or reusable solutions and removing future roadblocks.

Does it sound like you?

  • Computer science degree or other engineering degree equivalent
  • 3 years of product management
  • Experience delivering highly successful and innovative developer productivity platforms
  • Strong understanding of building scalable software solutions and complex engineering concepts
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate on a global scale with multiple engineering teams to help figure out gaps in our tooling and infrastructure and help drive solutions

What will you do?

  • Build product strategy and define end-to-end development experiences for all engineers across all of our businesses
  • Be responsible for all aspects of developer experience, from the local environment, internal tooling, libraries and open-source projects
  • Keep a laser focus on other engineering teams' productivity, efficiency, and reliability
  • Collaborate actively with a wide mix of backend engineers, mobile engineers, front-end engineers, product managers from various teams to figure out the most impacting solutions to build
  • Be a strong relay with the other PMs to keep the team aligned with the company by helping the team to understand what challenges product teams are going through, helping us to build better contextual awareness
  • Deliver love and happiness to other developers by empowering them to deliver apps and services at full pace and scale

Challenges you'll face with us

  • Build the best local environment a developer could hope for while dealing with the complexities introduced by our growth and a micro-service architecture
  • Create a simple yet powerful set of internal libraries for backend developers to help them to develop their micro-services while never impeding their ability to make their own choices
  • Work with the other PMs of the company to get a crystal clear understanding of where our stakeholders are headed, so you can understand better their needs.
  • Design generic solutions to address challenges faced by multiple teams and open-source them
  • Contribute to transitioning the backend architecture to an event-sourcing approach
  • Continuously learn through an extensive scope of technologies, from Docker to Event-Sourcing and Functional Programming to spot the most effective path to help the tech team

What's next?

  1. If your application is selected, the process will be composed of 4 steps:
  2. Non-technical interview with the Engineering Manager of your potential team (1h30)
  3. Take home assignment (~5 days deadline)
  4. Interview with your future teammates (1h)
  5. Day on site (Paris) to meet your future stakeholders

Check out our Engineering Blog and follow our twitter :)

You can also have a look at our open-source projects and contributions here.

Apply now

Heetch is a mobility app with a simple mission: We want people to enjoy going out.
Every night and every day, our drivers are doing their best to make their rides unforgettable and friendly! We are focused on young people's expectations and are competing within a fast-paced market.

The service launched in Paris in September 2013 has been growing ever since, with thousands of daily rides in France, Belgium, and Morocco. With more than 1 million users in Europe, we are proud to be one of the fastest growing French startups!

Wir sind der Überzeugung, dass Micromanagement tödlich ist für Kreativität und Produktivität. Wir bieten eine offene Arbeitskultur, in der die Mitarbeiter ihren Arbeitsort frei wählen können und sich den Tag selbst einteilen.

Wir entwickeln Software für die Unternehmens-IT, weil wir den Markt kennen und die Bedürfnisse von Fachabteilungen und Mitarbeitern verstehen. Wir wissen, wie IT-Profis arbeiten und welche Werkzeuge sie verwenden. Wir wissen auch, wie komplex ein großer Teil der Unternehmenssoftware ist. Wir wollen dazu beitragen, dass sich das ändert.

Unser Produkt uberAgent bietet tiefe Einsichten in User Experience and Anwendungsperformance von physischen PCs und virtuellen Desktops. Mit Hilfe dieser Informationen optimieren unsere Kunden die Geschwindigkeit, Sicherheit und Stabilität der Endgeräte ihrer Mitarbeiter.

Die Kombination aus einfacher Bedienung und wertvollen Metriken macht uberAgent zu einem Produkt, mit dem sehr gerne gearbeitet wird. Insofern passt es perfekt zu Splunk, einer leistungsfähigen und gleichzeitig benutzerfreundlichen Big Data-Plattform, die von uberAgent für Datenspeicherung und -visualisierung verwendet wird.

Deine Aufgaben

Wir leben Qualität. Bei uns gibt es keine Deadlines, keinen Stress, keinen Termindruck. Du bleibst „im Flow“ und machst das, was Du am besten kannst: großartige Software schreiben.

Du bist federführend für die Portierung unseres Endpoint Agent von Windows nach macOS verantwortlich. Zusammen mit Kollegen analysierst Du dazu im ersten Schritt den vorhandenen modernen C++1x Code. Anschließend optimiert ihr die Plattformunabhängigkeit. Im dritten Schritt geht es dann an die Erstellung des neuen Agents für macOS auf Basis eines gemeinsamen plattformunabhängigen Layers.

Das wünschen wir uns

Die einzigen Qualifikationen, die uns wirklich wichtig sind, sind der Drang, das bestmögliche Resultat zu erzielen und der Wunsch, jeden Tag etwas dazuzulernen.

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in C++
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in systemnaher Entwicklung unter macOS
  • Eigenständiges Arbeiten
  • Hang zur Perfektion
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
  • Hauptwohnsitz in Deutschland

Zusätzlich freuen wir uns über:

  • Erfahrungen mit Unternehmens-IT (um unsere Kunden besser verstehen zu können)

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

The Observability team is in charge of developing solutions that focus on application developers and engineers that run infrastructure and services supporting these applications. Elasticsearch is an efficient datastore for logs, metrics, and application traces, supporting the three pillars of observability. The Observability team builds and maintains solutions that make getting insights from this data turnkey and efficient, such as our APM, Infrastructure Monitoring, and Logs solutions. When developing these solutions, we think about the problem end-to-end: how do we automatically collect data from common data sources, store it efficiently in Elasticsearch, present this information to the user, correlate and enhance across data sources, what actions do we take on the insights from the data? All of these aspects are important in bringing a turnkey solution to the market.

As a Senior Product Manager responsible for the logging use case, you'll be involved with everything related to log analytics at Elastic, from directly impacting the roadmap to the go-to-market strategy. If you're passionate about working with massive amounts of logs and events, and want to work on open source log analytics with the Elastic Stack, this job is for you!

You would be working on

  • Engage with customers to understand use-cases and product requirements
  • Perform competitive analysis of the log analytics landscape
  • Enable sales and marketing to effectively speak to this use case
  • Drive roadmap by working with customers, internal teams and the community
  • Work with engineers and designers on the Kibana Logs UI product
  • Work with the Elasticsearch team on benchmarking and optimizing the logging use case
  • Write technical product updates and presentations

Who you are

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field (e.g. CS, CSE, EE) or relevant work experience in development, DevOps, solutions architecture, or pre-sales engineering
  • 2+ years in product management
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, a phenomenal teammate with strong analytical, problem solving, debugging, and troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to work in a distributed team throughout the world
  • Experience scoping and defining requirements for full-stack products (data ingest, data storage, and UI)
  • Experience with leading centralized log analytics products on the market
  • Familiarity with the Elastic Stack

Additional Information

We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life.

Job description

We are hiring for a key role focused on defining and bringing to market our new private cloud offering. This product package is targeted at customers who want the convenience of a cloud service managed by Auth0 with more enterprise-grade support options. We’re looking for a customer-oriented, technically savvy product manager to work side-by-side with the engineering team responsible for launching this offering. The product manager for private cloud will validate the offering via market analysis, customer interviews, competitive analysis, and collaboration with Auth0’s enterprise sales team. They will have strong experience in developing winning go-to-market strategies and feel right at home talking about SLAs, SLOs, deployment models, and cloud infrastructure.

You will:

    • Define the near and long-term strategy for the Auth0 PSaaS product offering and socialize it with stakeholders.
    • Establish sales targets, pricing strategy, and marketing model for PSaaS products.
    • Develop a cross-org playbook to drive consistency in how the product supports PSaaS customers.
    • Work with partners in finance, marketing, and sales to ensure financial success of your product offerings.
    • Seek feedback directly from customers during discovery and in early access/beta stages -- frequent customer contact is expected for all our product managers.
    • Analyze and synthesize signals from multiple sources: users, Auth0 field teams, market data, product usage data, competitive analysis, and others.
    • Work daily as a member of a dedicated team with engineering, organized around a shared mission.
    • Develop and test product hypotheses, working in a lean and iterative way.
    • Define and track KPIs and success metrics for your product area.
    • Work with partners in product marketing and our field teams to enable successful product launches.
    • Create assets to guide product development work (framing documents, user story maps, opportunity canvases, stories for implementation).

You might be a good fit for this role if you:

      • Love the work of identifying and deeply understanding customer problems.
      • Have empathy for users and seek their input at all stages of the product lifecycle.
      • Have strong go to market experience, including driving pricing and support decisions for an enterprise software subscription offering, developing launch and marketing plans, and rolling out a new offering to field teams.
      • Are a champion for collaborative, iterative product discovery, and embrace your role as a member of a cross-disciplinary team.
      • Have a degree of technical fluency that allows you to communicate with and understand your target audience (operators / sys admins).
      • Understand the fundamentals of cloud-based architecture, release management, and deployments; working familiarity with AWS is a plus.
      • Are experienced leading product teams in a B2B enterprise software company.
      • Like to get your hands dirty and use the products you build daily.
      • Are a great communicator.
      • Know how to make the complex approachable for users at all skill levels.
      • Have 3+ years as a product manager, preferably in a startup environment, with a minimum of 5 years working in the software industry.
      • Are self-motivated and comfortable working remotely.
      • Can travel domestically or internationally when required (15% or less).
Apply now

About Auth0

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We are transparent about how we run our recruiting process - you can read all about it here. You can also read about our company culture here.

  • Competitive Equity
  • Top-of-the-Line Macbooks and other great tools
  • Embrace Distributed Work
  • Inclusive Work Environment
  • Annual all-expenses paid international company offsite

Job description

We're looking for a Junior Content Marketing / SEO Specialist who is familiar with SEO, interested in digital marketing and excited to learn more about content marketing and inbound marketing.

About us

MailerLite is one of the fastest growing email marketing technologies. We help more than 600,000 businesses around the world keep in touch with their customers.

At MailerLite, we believe in keeping things simple — no corporate structure or unnecessary meetings. We have a flat organization with a team of highly-driven and talented people. Everyone on our team can pitch ideas for a new feature or propose a change and lead the project.

Our growing team of 45 people is united by enthusiasm for great products and delightful customer experiences.

We strive to build a company culture where work, socializing and personal development go hand in hand. Our culture is defined by 10 company values.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in writing marketing content by conducting keyword analysis and providing SEO guidelines
  • Outreach and relationship building with other relevant web properties
  • Market research and analysis
  • Analytics tracking and reporting
  • Create a digital marketing library for the marketing team, cataloging digital assets
